loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Motasem

texts.en:
Motasem is a 31-year-old single man. For the past 10 months, Motasem has been renting out items required for weddings to clients. This has been a profitable business since he is well known in the area where he lives and has a good reputation among customers. But his businesss needs support and improvements from time to time.
Motasem is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing supplies for weddings such as chairs, a wooden stage and lighting. This will improve his business and distinguish it, which will increase demand from customers and increase his income.
Motasem is photographed next to the wedding supplies he rents out.

loans.use: to buy supplies for weddings.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a resident of Malindi, Kenya and runs a transport business, providing transport through a motorcycle. He has been running this business for three years. He is a married father of one child. He also owns a cereals shop.

Despite the effect of unpredictable seasons, William aspires to own a larger shelter from where he can sell his goods. William learned of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase another motorcycle. He also desires to open other outlets in future.
William believes the additional income from this loan will help him educate his child once they join school.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Muthiani

texts.en:
Muthiani is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a second hand clothes shop, a business that he has been in operating for two years.

Muthiani learned about Milango through a Milango employee and joined the company with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is the seasonal business climate.

Muthiani is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy goats. He will use the sales to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Gs Paraiso De Oriente Group

texts.es:
La Señora Yadira, tiene  años 31 de edad, tiene 2 hijo que dependen de Ella esta soltera, Su actividad es el comercio tiene una pulpería y venta de ropa y productos de uso personal, cuenta con mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos ella cuenta con una buena clientela ya que por su amabilidad y el lugar donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio.
Doña Yadira esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, aceite, condimentos, ropa americana clasificada, papelería, productos de cosmetología y perfumería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo doña Yadira, le contribuirá a tener una mejor clientela  ya que se aproxima la temporada alta en ventas lo que le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Yadira uno de sus sueños es contar con su propio local para su negocio y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
La Señora Yorlina se dedica a realizar manualidades y servicios secretariales y de belleza cuenta con 4 años de experiencia.
La  Señora Claudia, se dedica al comercio cuenta con una venta de ropa americana desde hace 2 años de experiencia en el manejo del mismo.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Yadira is 31 years old, single, and has two children who are dependent on her. She is in the retail trade and has a convenience store, but she also sells clothing and personal use products. Yadira has been in business for more than four years and is able to generate income because she has a good clientele who appreciate her friendliness. Her business is also located in a good place.

Doña Yadira is requesting a loan in order to buy beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, condiments, American clothes, stationery, cosmetics, and perfumes so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. With the support of this loan, she will be able to attract more customers since the upcoming season is when she experiences high sales. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can cover her family’s expenses and her financial commitments. Among her dreams are to have a storefront for her business and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

The other members are as follows: • Sra. Yorlina makes handicrafts, but she also provides secretarial and beauty services. She has four years of experience. • Sra. Claudia is in the retail trade. She has a shop where she sells American clothing and has two years of experience.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras – October 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, condiments, American clothes, stationery, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Safeya

texts.en:
Safeya is 37 years old, married and a mother to five sons and four daughters,ages 3 to12, Her husband is a school employee who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Safeya wants to improve her children's daily living conditions, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of buying new clothes for her children. This will fulfill the needs of her children to wear suitable clothes as do other children.
Safeya is photographed in the picture with her younger daughter.

loans.use: to purchase necessary clothes to her children.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is 34 years old, married and a father to three sons. For the past two years, Rami has been driving a taxi and is well known among customers. This has been a profitable business and the only source of income for his family, but also it needs support to cover costs.
Rami is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing the taxi he drives. This will enable Rami to take additional internal and external requests and travel from one area to another legally, which will improve the family's income.
Rami is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to license the taxi.

loans.name: Yina Alexandra

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Yina, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la tiene  dos hijos de cinco años que son mellizos y estudian el primer año de escuela. Su marido es chofer.

Doña Yina para obtener sus propios recursos por el bienestar de su familia emprendió hace tres años su propio negocio, ella tiene un bar cerca de su casa en el cual vende una gran variedad de bocadillos y comida rápida, entre lo que más vende están los corviches,  panes de almidón, empanadas, batidos de frutas, colas, aguas  entre otros  productos. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, ella además también vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) para lo cual realiza sus recorridos en las mañanas. Le va muy bien en sus negocios y estos le ayudan a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar empanadas, frutas, sodas, pan de almidón entre otros productos que ella vende en su bar. Lleva  4 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Mujeres Organizadas meet every fortnight in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets that locals prepare, which are recognized throughout the country. 

This is where Yina lives. She is 27 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has two children who are five years old, twins, and study first grade. Her husband is a driver. 

In order to obtain her own resources for the welfare of the family, three years ago Yina started her own business. She has a bar near her home where she sells a variety of sandwiches and fast food. Among what she sells the most, there are "corviche", starch breads, pies, fruit shakes, sodas, water, and other products. She works every day in the afternoon. 

She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances and accessories for women). She does her routes in the morning. She is doing very well in her businesses and these help to get her family ahead.

This loan is to buy pies, fruits, sodas, starch bread, among other products she sells in her bar. She has four years in the communal bank and she likes it for the facilities to get loans. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pies, fruits, sodas, starch bread, etc..

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She is from Kapalaran, Tambulig and been 12 years in farming, earning an amount of 10,000 a month. In 2010, Anabelle joined GDMPC. Anabelle is requesting a loan of 15,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Behilla

texts.en:
Behilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines buying and selling vegetables. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables. 

Behilla has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from selling used clothing.

Behilla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en: Regie raises five hogs within his village. At his very best, Regie wisely manages his corn farming and hog raising business. Now, he plans to buy three additional piglets to raise and hog feed for their daily maintenance, so he is asking for additional working capital of 20,000 PHP. He hopes to obtain this loan amount to further improve the weight of his raised hogs upon reaching their optimum growth. Regie knows that it would really be of great impact to his business improvement because he could sustain them with nutritious hog feed and necessary vitamins to make them healthy.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for the daily maintenance of his hog raising business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working mother who supported her husband in generating income. She is now 45 years old, and has five children. The two youngest are still studying in tertiary education. To generate income, she engages in a hog-raising business.  She has done this work for almost five years, and usually has spent her income for the family's daily living costs, and the fees and expenses of sending her children to school. Due to high school fees, she needs to earn more income to support the children's education. 

She plans to improve her hog-raising business but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise, as well as feed, vitamins and vaccines for pigs. She hopes that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business and that someday she will make the business viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, as well as feed, vitamins and vaccines for pigs.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Zenaida ella es soltera y tiene 19 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también estudia pastelería, ella hace tortas y pasteles, la socia se dedica al restaurant 1 año, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras al por mayor.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de carpintería, negocio de restaurant, negocio de taller de soldadura y negocio de venta de pasteles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "LOS LIDERES", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Ruth Zenaida, one of the members, is 19 years old and single.  She runs a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She also studies to be a baker and makes pies and cakes.  Her restaurant has been in business for a year and she hopes to be able to get ahead through this activity.  Her goal is to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables, wholesale.

The other members are involved in carpentry, restaurant, welding workshop and bakery activities.

Ruth is grateful to all who take part in helping her reach her goal; and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables, wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el cantón  La Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena. Esta soltero y no tiene hijos. Él desde muy joven estudio la carrea que consiste en  reparaciones  eléctricos ya que siempre le ha gustado. En la actualidad tiene su propio taller de reparaciones y mantenimientos de televisores. Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas, pernos,llaves etc. Su sueño es agrandar el negociocomprarse unas perchas y vender repuestos de televisores
texts.en:
Luis, 46, lives in La Libertad canton in the province of Santa Elena. He is single and does not have any children. He learned his trade as an electrician from a young age, and has always enjoyed his work very much. Luis currently has his own electronics repair and television maintenance workshop.

With this loan, Luis wants to purchase tools, bolts, keys, etc. His dream is to expand his business, and buy himself some display racks and sell television parts.

loans.use: to purchase tools, bolts, keys, etc.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald es un joven entusiasta de 23 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, en un distrito rural. Desde los 19 años se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos que sus padres le otorgaron, desde entonces trabaja independientemente. Gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, consigue desenvolverse con eficiencia en el campo. Una de las mejores actividades que realiza, según él, es cultivar y abonar sus tierras, porque de eso depende la productividad de sus tierras. Él aspira a obtener más terrenos y producir más papas y arvejas, pues son los frutos que más satisfacciones le dan. Además de trabajar en sus propias tierras, también labora en parcelas ajenas y gana de 20 a 30 soles diarios. Ahora tiene planeado sembrar más papas, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Por su parte, reafirma su compromiso con sus socios del banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, en las actividades que se realicen. Ronald destinará los 2000 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en: Ronald is an enthusiastic 23-year-old youth. He is single and lives in his parents’ home in a rural district. Since he was 19 years old, he has been working in agriculture on land granted to him by his parents. Since then he has been working independently. Thanks to his parents’ teaching, he has managed to cope efficiently in the field. One of his best activities, according to him, is cultivating and fertilizing his lands, because this is what the productivity of his land depends on. He hopes to obtain more land and produce more potatoes and peas, as they are the fruits that give him the most satisfaction. In addition to working his own land, he also labors on others’ plots and earns 20 to 30 new Peruvian soles per day. Now he is planning to sow more potatoes, for which he requires support to acquire bags of organic fertilizer. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He says that he will be punctual in his loan repayments. He reaffirms his commitment with the other members of the communal bank “Nueva Jerusalén” in the activities that they carry out. Ronald will use the 2000 new Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer for his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Alegre y laboriosa, así es Ercilia una mujer de 36 años quien al lado de Paulino, padre de sus 2 hijos velan por el bienestar del hogar a base de esfuerzo. Poseen una casa hecha de madera que le fue cedido por sus padres. Dedicada a actividades agrícolas, halló una oportunidad de negocio, que es el tener una tienda de abarrotes, dicho negocio fue posible hace 4 años gracias a un pequeño dinero que tenia ahorrado y tambien, el apoyo de Paulino, quien se encargo de armar casi toda las estructuras necesarias para la exhibición de los productos en un espacio habilitado de su vivienda. Desde entonces muy contenta desempeña su trabajo de comerciante, pues esto le valió para ser hoy muy conocida en su barrio logrando captar mas clientela, haciendo de su negocio aun más  rentable. Últimamente vio que es posible realizar una ampliación de su local para hacerlo mas vistoso y  añadir variedad extra de productos, es por ello que tiene planeado realizar la compra de otro andamio y solicitar mas productos dentro de los cuales se encuentran las conservas de pescado muy solicitado por su clientela. En los posterior planea sacarle provecho a un espacio adicional de su vivienda para desempeñar la venta de prendar de vestir debido a que observo una buena demanda en ese rubro. Este es su cuarto crédito, la puntualidad fue su mejor herramienta para lograr que MFP confíe en ella incrementándole el capital de trabaj. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de andamios y víveres al por mayor para expandir su negocio , dentro de los cuales se encuentran las conservas de pescado en su mayoría así como  los cereales mas consumidos como el arroz , el trigo ,etc.
texts.en:
Cheerful and hard-working is Ercilia, 36, who lives with Paulino, the father of her two children.  They both look out for the welfare of the household through their efforts.  The wooden house they live in was given to them by her parents.  She is involved in agriculture but discovered a business opportunity which was to open a grocery store.  She established it four years ago thanks to a small amount of money she had saved and also with the help of Paulino, who put up almost all of the necessary shelving to display products in a room of the house.  Since then she is very happy with the work she does as a merchant.  This has made her very popular in the neighborhood where she has many customers and enjoys a profitable business.

Lately she has realized that she can expand the space to make it more attractive and add more variety of products.  So she is planning to buy another shelf and order more products such as canned fish, which is in much demand.  Then she wants to take advantage of an extra space she has at home where she could sell clothing, since she has observed a rising demand in this sector.

This is her fourth loan, and her good credit record was her best asset for getting MFP to trust her and increase the amount of the loan.  She plans to use the 3,000 PEN to buy shelving and wholesale groceries for her store.  These include canned fish, mainly, and popular cereals, such as rice and wheat.

loans.use: To buy canned fish, mainly, and also popular cereals such as rice and wheat.

loans.name: Saidchafar

texts.ru: Саидчафару 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами  3 года назад он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей DVD дисков. Он продает диски разных форматов и видов. У него много клиентов, которые покупают диски фильмов. Он хочет развевать свой ассортимент фильмов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки разнообразных дисков, чтобы расширить ассортимент и таким образом развевать бизнес и с дохода обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул «заботливого мужа и отца» перед семьей.
texts.en:
Saidchafar is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children in his care. In order to provide for his family, 3 years ago Saidchafar launched his own business buying and selling DVDs. He sells discs of various types and formats, and has many customers who buy his movies.

Saidchafar would like to expand his assortment of DVDs. To this end, he is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase a variety of discs and thereby increase his inventory. This will allow him to continue growing his business and to provide his family with all of life's necessities. Saidchafar is counting on your kindness. Together, let's help him maintain his role of a caring husband and father.

loans.use: to buy DVD discs and expand the assortment of his merchandise

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.ru: У каждого человека возникают проблемы и для его решения всегда помогают друзья. Пардабой, кто находится в финансовом недостатке, узнал, о милосердии кредиторов КИВА и обращается к вам за помощь как близким друзьям. Он очень трудолюбивый человек.  Ему 46 года, женат на прекрасную женщину Нисо и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более  10 лет он занимается земледелием и скотоводством. Скотоводство его основной бизнес и источник дохода,  а также он выращивает картошку и пшеницу. Он хочет развевать бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  3000  сомони для покупки семена и скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Everyone runs into problems from time to time, and friends always help to solve them. Pardaboy, who is experiencing financial difficulties, has learned about the charity of Kiva's lenders, and is now turning to you for help, as if to his close friends.

Pardaboy is a very hard-working person. He is 46 years old, married to a beautiful woman named Niso, and is raising 3 children. His home's climate is very favourable for growing crops and raising livestock. Animal farming constitutes Pardaboy's main business activity and source of income, and he also cultivates potatoes and wheat. He would like to develop his business, but lacks the funds to do so. Pardaboy is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase seeds and livestock in order to expand his farm. He plans to use his profits from this loan to provide his children with good education and modern technologies. Pardaboy is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and seeds in order to develop his business

loans.name: Emiliana Teodura

texts.es:
Emiliana es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros. Emiliana vive al lado de su madre a quien quiere muchísimo y a quien apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, Emiliana es una joven muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que tuvo que dejar de estudiar para poder trabajar y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. 

Emiliana trabaja como obrera en una empresa de fumigación, día a día trabaja alrededor de 9 horas, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de los problemas que ha afrontado.

Emiliana esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la cuota inicial para poder comprar un pequeño terreno y poder así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 19, is a young woman who lives in the district of Santiago, which is known for its very warm and welcoming climate.   It is also known for its agriculture, especially its grape, asparagus and other crop farming.  Emiliana lives with her mother who she loves very much and supports through the efforts of her work.  She is a very enthusiastic young lady who is determined to get ahead.  Since a very young age she learned to earn a living through hard work.  She was unable to continue her education because she had to work and help her mother cover the household expenses.

She works about nine hours a day for a fumigation company.  She believes work is going so well because she is very responsible and determined to get ahead despite the problems she has run into.

Emiliana is very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her make a down payment on a small patch of land where she hopes to carry out her greatest dream:  "To have her own house".

loans.use: To make a down payment on property.

loans.name: Jorge Leonardo

texts.es: Jorge tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos. Jorge desde muy joven  siempre le ha gustado todo sobre las reparaciones de  vehículos es por eso que decidió estudiar  mecánica, El padre lo apoyo para que diera la apertura a su propio taller mecánico ya que ese era su sueño y lo consiguió. El trabaja junto a 2 ayudantes de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de de la tarde. Con el préstamo comprara herramientas, aceites etc. Su meta es tener una maquina de balanceo automática en su taller para que asi sus clientes se sientan satisfechos
texts.en: Jorge, 24, is single and has no children.  At a very young age, Jorge learned that he enjoyed everything related to auto repair, so he decided to study mechanics.  His father helped him open his own workshop which was the goal he had, so he was able to achieve it.  He works with his two assistants Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  He will use the loan to buy tools, oils, etc.  His goal is to have an automotive balancing machine in his shop to make his customers happy.

loans.use: To buy tools, oils, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de principios centrados y muy reservada, comparte una vida conyugal junto a Juan con quien trata de lograr muchos objetivos que tiene a futuro, viven actualmente en una casa construida de madera sobre un terreno cuya propiedad fue de su madre. Dejando atrás las actividades agrícolas, debido a que su avanzada edad ya no le permitia; optó por dedicarse al servicio de corte de ccabello para damas y caballeros. Viene desempeñándose desde hace 8 años al lado de Juan quien también tiene un amplio conocimiento del rubro haciendo de éste un mutuo negocio de pareja el cual resulta motivador para ambos. En su lista de clientes más concurrentes  se encuentran vecinos y amigos quienes conocedores de su buen desempeño han logrado consolidar el negocio hasta el punto de convertirlo en una buena fuente de ingreso para el hogar considerando que sus ganancias son un poco más rentables ya que el local en donde se desempeñan es de su propiedad.
Planea realizar algunas mejoras en de su local así como la renovación de instrumentos para hacer de su trabajo mas fluido. Dentro de sus planes a futuro a manera de expandir sus ingresos planea aperturar otro negocio consistente en la venta de pollos a la parrilla debido a que a pronosticado una buena demanda por parte  de sus vecinos y transeúntes del lugar. Este es su préstamo número 13, siempre puntual es sus cuotas considera que el trabajo que ha ido desempeñando con MFP le favoreció en mas de una ocasión. Considera también el trabajo con su banco comunal es como una manera de crecer de manera conjunta con sus vecinos y amigos pertenecientes a su grupo. Con los 500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de algunos artefactos para su peluquería así como destinar parte del fondo para una leve remodelación de su local.
texts.en:
Gloria is a focused and very reserved woman who is married to Juan.  Together, they strive to meet their goals for the future.  They now live in a wooden house on property that belonged to her mother.  Because of her age, she decided to get out of the agriculture business and start a unisex hair salon service.  She and Juan, who also has experience in the sector, have been in business for eight years.  So working together has been a great motivation for them both.  Many of their customers are friends and neighbors who know how well they work, and how they have been able to turn the business into a more profitable source of income, since their activity is carried out on their own property.

She is planning to make some improvements in the salon and replace some of her work tools in order to make work flow more easily.  One of her goals for the future is to expand her activity by opening a roast chicken business because she is predicting a high demand from neighbors and visitors to the area.  This is her 13th loan and she has always paid them back on time.  She believes the help from MFP has been favorable to her on more than one occasion.  She also believes that working through her communal bank is the way to grow alongside her neighbors and friends who are in the group.  She will use the 500 PEN to buy beauty supplies and renovate her salon somewhat.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies and renovate her salon.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José vive en la ciudad de Quevedo Provincia de los Ríos tiene 35 años de edad está soltero. José comenzó hace años atrás trabajando para un familiar en un taller mecánico él era ayudante pero ese trabajo le comenzó a gustar y con el pasar de los años el se independizo y ahora tiene su propio taller mecánico. El alquilo un local para abrir su taller ya que trabaja desde lunes a sabados de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el préstamo el comprara herramientas, aceites, maquinas, etc. Su meta es lograr tener un taller grande con un local propio
texts.en: José lives in the city of Quevedo, province of Los Ríos. He is 35 years old and is single. José started working for a relative several years ago in a mechanic's workshop. He was an assistant but he started to like the work and over the years he went off on his own and now he has his own mechanic's workshop. He rented a locale to open his workshop and works Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. With the loan, he will buy tools, oils, engines, etc. His goal is to be able to have a big workshop in his own locale.

loans.use: to buy tools, oils and and engines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and chickens.

loans.name: Adriana Del Rocio

texts.es: Adriana  vive en el norte de Guayaquil en una zona llamada las Orquídeas. Ella tiene 46 años de edad es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos el mayor es mayor de edad y el menor estudia en un colegio público cerca del sector .Adriana comenzó su propio negocio hace 14 años atrás junto a su ex conviviente el negocio se trataba de una  panadería, a raíz que su ex esposo la abandono ella se tuvo que hacer cargo de sus hijos y de la panadería por completo. En la actualidad Adriana trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo menor. Ellos trabajan de lunes a domingo desde la 4 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito quiere comprar harina, manteca, mantequilla, huevos etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirla en una gran cafetería reconocida de Guayaquil.
texts.en: Adriana lives in northern Guayaquil in an area called Las Orquídeas. She is 46 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children. The oldest is grown and the youngest goes to a nearby public high school in the area. Adriana started her own business 14 years ago with her ex. THe business was a bread bakery. Because her husband abandoned her she had to completely take over raising her sons and running the bakery. Now, Adriana works with the help of her younger son. They work Monday though Sunday from 4 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. With the loan, she wants to buy flour, lard, butter, eggs, etc. Her dream is to expand her business and make it a well known cafe in Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, butter, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une femme de 46 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise en soirée et des beignets en matinée depuis 10 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (2 sacs de farine, 2 palettes de poisson, un bidon d'huile et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal is a 46-year old woman who is married and a mother. She is a trader and has been selling braised fish in the evenings and fritters in the morning for the past ten years in a district of the capital. Her know-how in this field and her prices have enabled her to acquire a loyal customer base which is growing day by day. She wants this loan because her capital is not sufficient to satisfy her customers any more. Thanks to the loan she will be able to increase her stock by buying two sacks of flour, two palettes of fish, a container of oil and firewood. The profits she makes with the help of this loan will be partly reinvested in her business and partly saved for her children's education. 

Note: The two pictures show Chantal at each of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of flour, two palettes of fish, a container of oil and firewood.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Mrs.Tsend-Ayush is a 54-year-old widow who lives with her 22-year-old son in a small house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her son works at a private company. Her other son, age 24, has been sent to Sierra Leone for peace work. Tsend-Ayush has been manufacturing traditional boots for years, and she started her manufacturing business in 2010 at her home. She has a lot of experience. But her business is temporarily not running because of a lack of working capital and equipment. She has the potential to run this business normally with enough profit to cover family expenses once she gets a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy inventory and equipment for her temporarily stopped traditional boots manufacturing business. She is a hardworking, modest and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for her temporarily stopped traditional boots manufacturing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children. Victoria lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, where she has earned a living for the last 30 years by selling home products and used items. She makes PHP 15,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Victoria joined GDMPC in 2010 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Emelia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, and groceries to resell at her general store business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, and groceries to resell

loans.name: Sukhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухробджон человек с прекрасной душой и реализует всех планов. Ему 32 года он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Более 13 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 долларов США, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sukhrobjon is a man with a beautiful soul and makes his goals a reality. He is 32 years old, married and is raising two children. He has been involved in cultivation of agricultural crops such as potatoes, wheat, carrots and etc. He sells the received harvest on the market. Because of high quality harvest his produce is in high demand. His wife helps him in running of the business. With the goal to provide for his family with all the necessary means Sukhrobjon wants to grow his business and has to get a large harvest. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500USD to buy mineral fertilizer. Sukhrobjon will use the received profit from the business to pay for education of his children and improvement of living conditions of his family. He needs and awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María tiene 70 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en el municipio de tela junto a un hijo. Ella es una persona emprendedora, cristiana y con muchos deseos de seguir trabajando. Anteriormente trabajaba en una institución y hace ya 14 años que decidió por su propio negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y ropa interior, zapatos, cremas, desodorantes, champú, talcos y otros productos de aseo personal. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Este préstamo que ha solicitado es el tercero y es por 7,500 Lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para comprar más ropa, cremas, champú, lociones, desodorantes y otros de aseo personal para incrementar el inventario y cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene pendientes de sus clientes. Su meta es crecer espiritualmente, llegar a tener una tiendita de ropa en un lugar fijo y seguir trabajando para tener siempre calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 70, is a single mother.  She lives with a son in the Tela municipality.  She is an enterprising Christian woman with a great desire to keep working.  She previously worked at an institution.  Fourteen years ago she decided upon her own business of selling women’s and men’s clothes, underwear, shoes, creams, deodorants, shampoo, talcum powder, and other personal hygiene products.  She does this in an itinerant manner and by orders from her customers.

This loan that she has requested is her third loan, and it is for 7,500 lempiras.  She will use it to buy more clothes, creams, shampoo, lotions, deodorants, and other personal hygiene products in order to increase her inventory and fill the customer orders that are pending.  Her goal is to grow spiritually and to have a small clothing store in a fixed place.  She also wants to continue working in order to always have quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, creams, shampoo, lotions, deodorants, and other personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en: Isidro, 48, is married with 3 children; he resides in Kaparalan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Isidro raises crops for a living, planting and harvesting coconuts and corn for sale in the local community. This has been his business for 5 years. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plant. In 2010, Isidro joined GDMPC. In the future, Isidro wants to save to prepare for future emergencies and purchase another piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plants

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Emma has been raising livestock for 3 years; she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to build and expand her business, securing the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 27, is married and has 2 children. She lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Josephine owns and operates a farm,  planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 9,000 PHP doing this. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Manuel Alfredo

texts.es: Manuel vive en la ciudad de Manta de la provincia de Manabí. El tiene 42 años de edad, está soltero, tiene 1 hijo que asiste a una escuela pública. Comenzó su propio negocio de panaderia y pasteleria hace 14 años ya que El había tomado 1 curso de panadería. En la actualidad Manuel trabaja solo  de lunes a domingo desde la 4 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito quiere comprar harina, manteca, mantequilla, huevos etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirla en una gran panadería reconocida en Manta
texts.en: Manuel lives in Manta in the Manabí province. He is 42 years old, single and has one son who attends a public school. He started his own business baking cakes and bread 14 years ago because he had completed a level 1 bakery course. Currently, Manuel works alone from Monday to Sunday between the hours of 4am and 5pm. With this loan, he intends on buying flour, lard, butter and eggs etc. His dream is to keep on growing his business until it becomes a large bakery and is well-known throughout Manta.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, butter and eggs etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic needs food items (sugar, rice, beans, shortening, eggs, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods) and other items like Christmas decorations to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of eggs, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and other items to sell in her general store.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from musical entertainment (videoke).

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggs, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgon is a 51-year-old widow who lives in a ger in the province of Arkhangai in Mongolia. 

She started her business in 2005 by selling secondhand clothes at the local market. Her business activity is normal. She already has gained several years of practical experience. She is planning to operate her business in her own workplace in the near future. So far, her business working capital has reached 800,000 MNT and her business has proved to be profitable over time. 

Mrs. Otgon is an open-minded and positive person. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase winter clothing from the capital city and sell it at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing from the capital city and sell it at the local market.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs and food vending. 

Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm land and open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Telma

texts.es: Telma tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Telma tiene su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace 15 años, donde vende productos de consumo diario como frijoles, maíz, verduras, frutas, churros, queso, crema, refrescos, dulces, etc. Ella quiere tener su negocio surtido para generar más ingresos, y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar frutas de temporada, frijoles, maíz, verduras y productos lácteos para vender. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para seguir con la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Telma, age 58, is a single mother, and she has four children.  She lives in the Tela municipality of Atlántida.

Telma has had her own business, a grocery store, for 15 years.  She sells daily consumption products like beans, corn, vegetables, fruits, churros, cheese, cream, soft drinks, and candy, etc.  

She wants to have her business stocked in order to generate more income.  She has decided to request a loan for 8,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal fruit, beans, corn, vegetables, and dairy products to sell.  Her plan is to make her business grow in order to continue her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruit, and dairy products for her business.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana is a 50-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has two children, ages 25 and 23. She is engaged in buying and selling bermuda grass, a medium- to fine-textured warm-season turf grass that has has excellent heat, drought, and salt tolerance but does not do well in shade. 

Aside from this business, she raises hogs. She earns 5,000 PHP a month from both business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more bermuda grass, piglets and feed. Germana would like to augment her business to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy bermuda grass, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de imprenta, ella realiza trabajos de tarjetas de cumpleños, de matrimonios recibos entre otros trabajos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de imprenta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papeles, pinturas y pinceles.
La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal sembrando y los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurant, negocio de taller de carpintería y negocio de venta de pasteles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the "SEMBRANDO" communal bank. This communal group is located in Cusco within the province and department of Cusco.
The member applying for this loan is Sra. Asunta, who is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She works in her printing business where she creates greetings cards for birthdays, weddings and other occasions from 8am until 5pm. Her business helps her to provide for her family's future and her dream is to expand her printing business. The group member is applying for this loan in order to buy paper, paints and paintbrushes.
The group member whose face is covered over with a circle is no longer a member of the "SEMBRANDO" communal bank and the group memebrs whose photos are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting as they had notified the Field Partner that they had prior working commitments. 
The businesses run by the other group members include a grocery store, a restaurant business, a carpentry workshop and a cake seller.
Sra Asunta is grateful to anyone who helps to make her dream come true with this loan and she promises to fulfil her repayment schedule in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy paper, paints and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Tserenbadam

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserenbadam is 24 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the province of Ovorkhangai in Mongolia. Her husband drives a minivan and provides public transportation services. She works for a local non-government organization. 

Mrs. Tserenbadam has been producing handmade accessories at home during her free time. She sells them to her friends and relatives. She has been doing this since 2010. 

She is now planning to open her own business producing handmade accessories and selling them at a rental counter in the local market. 

Mrs. Tserenbadam is a diligent and hardworking woman who is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and to pay for the expense of a rental counter for her new business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and to pay for the expense of a rental counter for her newly started business.

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
Jenith is 43 years old and married. She is the mother of five children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Jenith has earned a living for the last 11 years from buying and selling fruits. She earns PHP 4,000 a month. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fruits to sell such as mangoes and bananas. 

Jenith joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell such as mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Delcina

texts.en: Delcina is a 52-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 31, while the youngest is 26. She raises hogs. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets, feeds, like hog booster and hog finisher mash, and pig supplements, like anti-diarrhea medicines that help the pigs to grow healthy. In the future, Delcina would like to invest in other business ventures in order to have a sustainable livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a widow. He is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Rodrigo is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earns 15,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC. Rodrigo hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Amormia

texts.en: Amormia, 36, is a married entrepreneur from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children and makes a living from her transport service business. She started this business almost 11 years ago and she earns 10,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 50,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which Amormia joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a 35000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her general store. 

Lorna has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tuvshin

texts.en: Mr. Tuvshin is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in small house in Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife Myagmarsuren, aged 26, gave birth to a daughter 8 months ago and is staying with their daughter at home. His son Osohbayar, aged 17, has just enrolled in university this year. He has been operating a public transportation service business since 2007. He is a hardworking, honest and responsible man who says that his goal is to educate his children and let them live a better life in future. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to cover his son's university tuition and other school-related expenses to get his son highly educated.

loans.use: To cover his son's university tuition and other school-related expenses to get his son highly educated

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and reselling charcoal. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a retail store owner who has extended good services to his customers for over 10 years now. He is married to his partner in managing the store. Aside from the retail store, the couple also raises hogs for additional income. They usually gain 8,000 PHP each month from their businesses. 

He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to invest in expanding his sales. He will buy to buy coffee, bread, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

Someday, he hopes to achieve a stable income from their businesses so he can pay his four children's school expenses. He had 10 children, but the rest have settled into marriage and live apart from him. His photo was taken when he was arranging his merchandise at the store.

loans.use: to buy coffee, bread, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 47 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is married to a farmer. She sells rice to earn an income. She gains about PHP 500 for each sack of rice she sells. Marilyn would like to increase her sales as well as her income, but she has insufficient funds to do this. She is now asking for PHP 10,000 to buy rice to sell. She hopes to keep acquiring good income from her small business and pay for the school expenses of her children. She will be happy and proud to see them as professionals in their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny's main source of income comes from his corn-raising business. He is 22 years old, single. He is from Tugas, Tangub City and been 6 years in farming, earning an amount of 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Manny joined GDMPC. Manny is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old, married and has six children. To make a living, she buys rice and re-sells it for a profit. She usually earns about P500 for each sack of rice sold. She has been able to give daily allowances to her children out of her income. Her spouse is a farmer. Giving a good education to all their children is their main goal. 

Now, Marissa would to borrow a loan of P10,000 to buy three sacks of rice to sell. It will help her continuously offer rice to her customers. Someday, she hopes to expand her business and keep earning a profit from it.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store like bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store like bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Alberto Alejandro

texts.es: Alberto vive en  la ciudad de Quevedo provincia de Los Ríos tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijo. Su padre le enseño el trabajo familiar que es la fundición de acero. En la actualidad trabaja junto a su padre de lunes a sábado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde. Con el crédito comprara un horno para fundir el acero de bronce. Sus  aspiraciones son  tener varios hornos para fundir metales y poder enseñar este trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Alberto lives in the city of Quevedo in the Los Ríos province. He is 24 years old, single, with no children. His father taught him the family business, which is steel smelting. He now works with his father from Monday through Saturday, from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

With the loan, he will purchase a furnace to smelt bronze steel. His aspirations are to have various furnaces to smelt metals and to be able to teach this work to other people.

loans.use: to buy a furnace to smelt metals.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel es una mujer de 54 años de edad esta en unión simple con su esposo y vive en Sololá. Tiene 6 hijos de ellos 2 varones de los cuales ellos están casados,  también  4 mujeres de ellas 1 esta casada 2 están estudiando y 1 que trabaja independientemente.
Es una persona amable y sobre todo trabajadora, ella se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que se utilizan la mujer indígenas de su región. Esto  los vende en el mercado local y a personas que le hacen algunos pedidos personales.
Ella  inicio este trabajo hace 25 años atrás, aprendiéndolo de su madre cuando aun viva con ella.  Decide realizar este trabajo después de casada ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en alguna escuela por la baja economía de su familia. Junto a su esposo aportan ahora los ingresos y mejorando las condiciones de vida de la familia.
Por la temporada del año ha visto que esta prenda tiene mejor demanda, de esta manera desea invertir más capital en su materia prima. Solicita un préstamo de  Q 3,000.00 para comprar hilo de varios colores y jaspeado (hilo teñido con figuras)  para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es ver a sus últimas 2 hijas teniendo una carrera profesional académica, con el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is a woman of 54. She and her husband live in Sololá. They have six children, two sons who are married, and also four daughters, of whom one is married, two are in school, and one works independently.

She is a friendly person and, above all, hard-working. Her work is making traditional clothing that the indigenous women in her region use. She sells these items in the local market and to people who give her special orders.

She began this work 25 years ago, having learned it from her mother when she was still living with her. She decided to do this work after she married, since she hadn't had the opportunity for any education because of the low economic level of her family. Along with her husband, she now contributes to the family income and they are improving the living conditions of the family.

She has seen that this clothing has greater demand at this time of the year, so she wants to invest more capital in her basic supplies. She is applying for a loan of 3,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy thread of various colors and "jaspeado" (thread woven with figures) to make a greater quantity of clothing and have better earnings.

Her greatest dream is to see her two youngest daughters complete their secondary school training, with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 47 years old, married with 2 adults and 1 school-age child in her family.  She lived in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  The major source of income of the family is fishing, primarily operated by her husband, operated for 3 years having an average monthly income of Php 2,800.  

Nimfa took another loan from PMPC to purchase fishing net.  She hopes to catch more fish using her new fishing net to provide the daily needs of the family and put aside savings for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is married and has 1 child. She is 32 years old, and she lives in Polacion, Bonifacio. Faith owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. In 2011, Faith joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and better her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Don Jorge es un hombre de agricultor de 46 años de edad, el esta casado y vive en Suchitepéquez. Junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos la cual el mayor estudia una carrera académica y los otros dos estudian educación básica.
El es un hombre trabajador siendo así su actividad principal el  cultivo de café al igual que su esposa trabaja como ama de casa juntos aportando a la economía de la familia.
El quiere emprender un nuevo negocio ya que el obtuvo un kiosco de una empresa de bebidas gaseosas donde el  quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes.
De esta manera el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la comprar mercadería para luego poder hacer la apertura de su tienda de abarrotes.
Esto es con el fin de poder  mejorar sus condiciones económicas de la familia teniendo como una meta y un sueño de poder terminar de darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Jorge is farmer who is 46 years old. He is married and lives in Suchitepéquez with his wife and their three children. The oldest child is high school, and the other two are in the first years of secondary school.

He is a hard-working man, since his main activity is growing coffee, while his wife works as a homemaker, together supporting the family economy.

He wants to begin a new business, since he obtained a kiosk from a soft drink business,  and there he wants to set up a grocery store. To do this, he is applying for a loan of 5,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy merchandise so that he will then be able to open his grocery store. He is doing this with the goal of being able to improve the economic conditions of his family. His goal and dream is to be able to give a high school education to his children.

loans.use: to buy groceries to begin his buisness.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Don Natividad es un hombre agricultor de 36 años de edad esta en unión simple con su esposa y vive en Sololá.
El se dedica al cultivo de verduras tales como cebolla, papa, zanahoria, ejote y repollo, esto lo cultiva en parcelas que alquila a pocos metros de su residencia, siendo así su principal fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. 
Tiene 18 años de realizar esta actividad, ya que es el primer trabajo que le enseño su padre desde que el estudiaba la mitad de la jornada del día y trabajaba la otra mitad. 
Desde que el termino sus estudios de una carrera académicas quiso seguir trabajando en la agricultura ya que estas verduras han mantenido el precio en el mercado local generando ganancias buenas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Por  la temporada del año   las cosechas son mejores así que el decide solicitar un préstamo de Q3,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y fertilizante que utilizara para cultivar esta verdura expandiendo mas su cultivo.
Tener una parcela propia es su mayor sueño, ya que ahora tiene que pagar para poder cultivar estas  verduras en parcelas que alquilando.
texts.en:
Don Natividad is a farmer of 36. He and his wife live in Sololá. He grows vegetables such as onions, potatoes, carrots, green beans, and cabbage. He grows these on parcels of land that he rents a few meters from his home. This is his principal source of income for his family.

He has been doing this work for 18 years, since it is the first work that his father taught him, since he went to school for half a day and worked for the other half.

After he finished his high school studies, he wanted to continue working in agriculture, since these vegetables have maintained their price in the local market, generating good earnings to improve the living conditions of his family.

At this season of the year, the harvests are better, and so he decided to apply for a loan of 3000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer that he will use to grow these vegetables, expanding his crops more.

To have his own parcel of land is his greatest dream, since now he has to pay to be able to grow these vegetables on parcels that he rents.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 41 years old, and his wife, Chrep, is 39. They have been married since 2012 and have four daughters. Two are garment workers and other two are in school. The family lives in a village about 28 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Touch fishes and builds houses for a living, while his wife is a garment worker. In addition, they grow rice when rice farming season comes.  

Touch is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,300 to improve his rice farm. He will use it to buy fertilizer and purchase a cow to raise.

He hopes he will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm and purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Isrrael Rufino

texts.es: Isrrael  vive en el sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil  llamado Las Orquídeas. Está casado tiene 2 hijos. El comenzó su negocio que es la  venta  de  comida, se inicio con este negocio  ya hace 12 años atrás a causa de la falta de empleo que tiene el país, el  no conseguía trabajo por eso tomo la decisión de dar la apertura al negocio de venta de comida en su casa. El trabaja junto a su esposa de lunes a viernes desde las  10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara una cocina industrial y víveres en general. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante reconocido en el país por sus comidas típicas ecuatorianas.
texts.en:
Isrrael lives in the northern sector of the city of Guayaquil named Las Orquídeas. He is married and has two children. He began his business, which is food sales, 12 years ago. Because of the lack of employment in his country, he could not find work, and so he decided to open the business of food sales in his home. He works with his wife from Monday through Friday from 10 in the morning until 10 at night. 

With the loan, he will buy a new industrial stove and general supplies. His dream is to have a great restaurant well-known in the country for its typical Ecuadorian food.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and general supplies.

loans.name: Mokote

texts.fr: Mokote est un homme de 27 ans, célibataire, père d'un enfant âgés de  02 ans.Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale où il gère une mini quincaillerie depuis 1 ans.Son activité étant certe jeune, mais  grâce à sa qualité de bon commerçant a pu en si peu de temps fidéliser une clientèle considérable, mais qu'il n'arrive cependant plus à satisfaire car son capital ne lui permet guère de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante susceptible de satisfaire la demande croissante.Afin de palier à ce problème, il voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en diluants,seaux de peintures, tôles et biens d'autres produits de quincaillerie, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande, mais surtout d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande quincaillerie, mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mokote, age 27, is a single father of a 2-year-old child. Over the past year, he has been running a small hardware store in a district of the capital. While this is a rather new activity, his strengths as a businessman have helped him to quickly build a substantial and loyal customer base, which he can no longer satisfy due to a lack of funds needed to maintain his stock of merchandise. 

To overcome this hurdle, he is seeking a loan to stock up on merchandise such as thinners, buckets, paint, sheet metal, and many other hardware products. This will help him to meet customer demand and to bolster his sales and his profits. 

He plans to use these profits to expand his activity and turn it into a large hardware store, and to provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to stock up on hardware items such as light bulbs, paint, sheet metal, thinners, buckets, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a new recognized member of PMPC under the individual program. She is 44 years of age and married with two adult-age children. Her major business is a sari-sari (variety) store for selling a variety of basic commodities. She has operated the business for two years, having a monthly income of 4,000 Php (Philippines pesos).  

She decided to join PMPC to have financial access to support her business. She took her first loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional grocery stock for sale, hoping to generate more sales to increase the income to invest more capital in the business and to save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva of Poblacion, Bonifacio, helps her family through running a barber shop business. She’s a 49-year-old married mom of three kids who tries her best to earn on her own. For 16 years, she has managed this business and earns about 4,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. 

For the time being, she’s in need of buying scissors, combs and items to use in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of 5,000 PHP they provided to her. Eva desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs and items to use in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Violeta has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor  vive en la ciudad de Quevedo tiene 25 años de edad. Es  divorciado tiene 3 hijos que estudian en una escuela pública del sector. El  se había quedado sin trabajo  hace 6 años atrás y fue ahí  cuando un amigo lo llevo a trabajar vendiendo frutas y legumbres. En  la actualidad el se ha independizado y dio la apertura  en los exteriores de su casa un puesto de venta de frutas y legumbres. Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres, hortalizas, frutas. Su sueño es tener un local propio y llegar a ser un distribuidor mayorista de frutas y legumbres para así poderle dar a sus hijos una excelente vida
texts.en:
Víctor lives in the city of Quevedo.  He is 25 years old.  He is divorced with three children that attend a public school in the area.  He had been without work six years ago and it was then that a friend took him to work selling fruits and vegetables.  At present he has become independent and gave the opening of the exterior of his house over to a place from which to sell fruits and vegetables. 
 
He wants to buy legumes, vegetables and fruits with the loan.  His dream is to have his own business location and to become a wholesale distributor of fruits and vegetables to thus be able to give his children an excellent life.

loans.use: to buy legumes, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 6 hijos. Reside en compañía de su suegra, esposo, he hijos en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Doña María siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde hace 15 años que se dedica a la  producción de café, maíz y frijoles para la venta.
Actualmente ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  25,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pago de jornaleros para la limpieza de la finca y los cultivos.
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a proporcionar el manejo adecuado para obtener mayor rendimiento de sus cultivos, su meta es lograr hacer producir 11 manzanas de tierra con el cultivo de café.
texts.en:
María, age 55, is in a common-law marriage, and she has six children.  She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, and her children in a rural community in the Nueva Frontera municipality in the Santa Barbara department.

María has always worked in agriculture.  For 15 years she has been producing coffee, corn, and beans that she sells. 

She has currently requesting a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay day workers to clear the farm and the crops.  She feels that the loan will help her provide adequate management in order to get greater yield from her crops.  Her goal is to manage to produce 11 ‘manzanas’ [a land measurement] of coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and to pay day workers to clear the farm and the crops.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha and her husband are farmers. They grow sesame and beans on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition to caring for their crops, Sokha is a weaver and her husband raises cows at home. The couple has been married since 2005, and they have two children, one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other is too young for school. The family is living in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Sokha requests a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller. Because she does not have her own motorized hand tiller, she has to spend lots of money for renting one. With the motorized hand tiller that she will buy with money from the loan, Sokha will not have to spend lots of money to rent the equipment she needs any more.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: Freddy vive en el  cantón La Libertad, de la provincia de Santa Elena, tiene 21 años de edad es soltero, Actualmente estudia en la universidad la carrera de  ensamblaje de computadoras. El trabaja en lo que le gusta que es la reparaciones de computadoras. Actualmente en su casa dio la apertura de un taller de reparaciones de computadoras. Con el préstamo comprara herramientas, piezas de computadoras. Su meta es abrir un cyber.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in La Libertad canton, Santa Elena province. He is 21, single and he studies computer assembly at the university.

He enjoys repairing computers, and that is why he has this line of work. He recently opened a computer repair workshop in his house.

With the loan, he will buy tools and spare parts. His goal is to open a cybercafé.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for computers.

loans.name: Ricardina Marleny

texts.es: Ricardina vive en el sur de Guayaquil en  un barrio llamado  El Guasmo. Es casada tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Ricardina  comenzó de casualidad ya que ella iba a dejar a un nieto a la escuela en su carro y las madres de los alumnos le pidieron  que les haga expreso a sus hijos también. En la actualidad ella ofrece transporte de servicio escolar. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar llantas, pintar el carro etc. Su meta es comprarse otro carro mas para alquilarlo y que le genere más  ingreso a su casa
texts.en: Ricardina lives in the south of Guayaquil in a neighborhood called “El Guasmo”. She’s married with 2 children who are both independent adults. Ricardina started her business by chance when she was dropping off her grandson to school in her vehicle and the mothers of the other students asked her to drop off their children too. Currently, she offers transportation with school service. With the loan, she wants to buy tires and paint for her vehicle. Her goal is to buy an extra vehicle to lease it and earn additional household income.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for her vehicle.

loans.name: Elmer
