It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Paula dreams of having a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Besiki

texts.en:
Besiki is 48 years old and lives in Telavi, Kakheti region, East Georgia. He has a large family: a wife, two sons (22 and 17 years old), a daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild. Besiki requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Besiki worked as a taxi driver and transported people from Telavi to the capital city. A storm and hail damaged his car and he has stopped working. The only source of the income for the family is his wife’s small salary from a kindergarten. It is hardly enough for food for a six-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besiki requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business (taxi service) that was stopped recently because of a natural calamity (storm damage). His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Besiki will purchase a car. He will be able to continue working as a taxi driver and serve the local people. This business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comestibles,el socio tambien trabaja en una construccion civil,su esposa es la atiende el negocio de venta de comestibles,juntos quieren salir adelante,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio de venta de comestibles y en su trabajo ya tiene 7 años,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de comestibles.El socio solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

El socio esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a pagar los cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to earn a living selling foodstuffs. He also works in civil construction. His wife looks after the business of selling foodstuffs. Together they hope to move forward successfully. The borrower has been in the business of selling foodstuffs for six years now, and has worked at his job for seven years. 

His dream is to expand his business selling foodstuffs. He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale. He is happy to have a loan and is committed to repaying in installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir nuevamente, comprándose frutas y verduras frescas, así como tambien pescado, esto permitirá que Víctor ofrezca mejor calidad y en frutos más variedad en manzanas, bananas, cebollas, tomates, y tambien mariscos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mejores ingresos, sus condiciones en su familia han mejorado, pero necesita continuar  trabajando  para  mantener las condiciones.
texts.en: Victor decided to take out another loan out of the need to invest again, buying fresh fruits and vegetables, as well as fish. This will allow Victor to offer better quality [products] and a greater variety of fruits, including apples and bananas, as well as onions, tomatoes, and also seafood. The previous loan helped him to increase his inventory and obtain better earnings. His family's living conditions have improved, but he needs to continue working to maintain those conditions.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, onions, tomatoes, and also seafood

loans.name: Gs Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
La señora Martina de 55 años de edad, vive con su conyugue en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad al sur de Honduras,  se dedica a la  actividad que es: la venta de fresco y un molino de moler maíz, se dedica al negocio desde hace 15 años  en su casa de habitación,  sus clientes son los todos los vecino de la comunidad. 
Doña Martina solicita el préstamo para comprar  frescos y repuesto para su molino. Con el préstamo espera tener mejores ganancias, ya que los últimos meses del año son cuando mejoran sus ventas.
Doña Martina con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo quienes se dedican a la venta de tortillas, nacatamales, pan y alfarería, ellas son Doña  María Y Doña Hilda residentes en la misma comunidad.
Doña Martina su sueño es tener el negocio mas surtido de la comunidad y brindarles mejor atención a sus  clientes.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Martina, age 55, lives with her husband in their own home that is located in a community in southern Honduras. She sells soft drinks and also has a mill for grinding corn. Martina has been in business for 15 years and works from home. Her customers are all of her neighbors from the community.

Doña Martina is requesting a loan so that she can buy soft drinks and spare parts for her grain mill. With this loan, she hopes to generate better earnings since the final months of the year are when her sales usually improve.

With the support of this loan, Doña Martina plans to continue investing in her business and growing alongside her fellow group members. Doña María and Doña Hilda are residents of the same community and earn their living by selling tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, bread, and pottery.

Doña Martina hopes to have a business that is well-stocked for her community so that she can provide better service to her customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and spare parts for her grain mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replant his coffee fields.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz, se le presenta la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para surtir la tienda de productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, y otros artículos, esto hará que Luz mantenga un negocio mas surtido.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio de la venta de medicina, incrementando el inventario para obtener mejores ventas con los clientes, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado con relación al crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Luz has the opportunity to continue investing in the business which is why she’s asking for a loan to stock her store with basic staples like beans, rice, sugar and other items allowing Luz to have her store better-stocked.

The previous loan helped her strengthen the business with the purchase of medicines increasing inventory to obtain better sales with the customers.  Her economic conditions have improved in relation to the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh seafood, fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Solidario Orquideas Group

texts.es: Solidario Orquideas. este grupo está conformado la señora Olga tiene 41 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde hace 7 años se siente muy contenta ya que su negocio esta prosperando, está solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elaboración y venta de tortillas espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Solidario Orquideas [Orchid Solidarity]. 

Forty-one year old Olga is a member of this group. She is married and has three children. For the past seven years she has earned a living making and selling tortillas. She is very pleased because her business is thriving. 

She is requesting this loan to buy corn that will be used to make and sell tortillas. She hopes you can help with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 23-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. Due to his desire to become self-employed he started a retail shop; he also deals in mobile money services, Godfrey believes his community benefits from his business in a very positive way because the service he provides is faster than other money transfer services and more often has sufficient cash to pay out receiving customers.

When Godfrey receives his loan he will be able to increase his float money (electronic and cash value of his working capital), thereby enabling him to satisfy more customers and also buy beer and mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and mineral water to sell and increase his float money.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual s e caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se pueden apreciar muchos atractivos turísticos, los cuales son muy visitados en cualquier época del año. Julio vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y quien le brinda todo el ánimo y el apoyo para seguir adelante. En su tiempo libre a Julio le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, pero le encanta también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”.

Julio trabaja cada día con mucho empeño en una empresa como operario, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pintura, arena fina, entre otros, con lo cual realizara mejoras en su vivienda, principalmente arreglos de las paredes que se encuentran resquebrajadas; de esta manera tendrá un mejor ambiente para vivir y seguirá esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su casa propia y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Julio, 21, is a young man living in the city of Pisco noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Many tourist sites are also here that receive visitors year-round.  Julio lives with his wife who is his right hand and who provides him with all the encouragement and support needed to get ahead.  In his free time, Julio enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors but also loves to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious Duck with Rice.

Julio works very hard every day as an employee in a firm; he works about 9 hours daily and is able to cover household expenses this way.  He’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the great help they’ve provided him, he’ll be able to buy building materials and supplies like cement and fine sand, among others, to do some home improvements, particularly repair the cracked walls.  In this way, he’ll have a better living environment and will continue striving to reach his greatest dream: to own a house and have his own business.

loans.use: to buy cement, fine sand and other building supplies.

loans.name: Radio San Gabriel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RADIO SAN GABRIEL”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de mantas de vicuña, producción de sacos, tejido de polainas, tienda de barrio, hiladora, librería y fotocopiadora, producción de chicharrones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace años atrás conjuntamente su familia posteriormente ella decide realizar su negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Sofía ya que estaba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
Radio San Gabriel Communal Bank will start its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and headed by a board of which Paulina is the director.  The diverse business of the members of the communal bank include making vicuña blankets, making bags, weaving leggings, neighborhood store, spinning, bookstore and photocopying, and making cracklings.

The loan they're getting will benefit a group of small business entrepreneurs to which Paulina belongs.  She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a facilitator who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business making blankets.  She says she started this business three years ago with her family and later decided to work on her own.

The loan she's getting now is to increase her capital buying wool, which she'll get from distribution companies.  After production, she'll sell in the markets in the city of El Alto.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, because she's married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says she likes sharing with her colleagues.

Sofía isn't in the photograph because she had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nylon thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old, married and has nine children. One of her children is in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for 17 years and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of  hard working women. Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail store where she sells soap, sugar and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other commodities to stock in her store such as sugar and cooking oil and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and to shore up the family. Juliet hopes that in the future, she hopes the business gets bigger. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy other commodities to stock in her store such as sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Roba Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROBA CORAZONES”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda múltiple de barrio, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, venta de coca, costura de edredones, venta de muebles, venta de tela.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una de sus familiares que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de telas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente con su suegra hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito rápido.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank,"ROBA CORAZONES (Heart Breakers)," will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  The group has nine members and is headed by a board where Mercedes is the President. The members of the community association are involved in various businesses such as: running multiple neighborhood stores, weaving blankets, sewing jackets, selling coca leaves, sewing quilts, selling furniture, and selling fabric.

The requested loan will be used to benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Mercedes.  She indicates that nine years ago she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of one of her relatives who is a member of the institution. Today, she has a business selling fabrics.  She has undertaken this business jointly with her mother for several years.
 
The requested loan is to increase her capital (by buying fabric) that she will acquire from distribution companies.  She will later sell the fabric in her retail space. This workflow allows her to generate resources to support her family financially because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes replies that she likes the fast credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arooz,azucra,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is still working in her grocery store business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8am to 10pm. She has been working in this business for eight years and it is going very well. 

Zoraida is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale. She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Mechita

texts.es:
Doris, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Armando quien es policía, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 12 años de edad, que son lo mejor que le ha dado la vida.  Vive en una bonita casa que logró construir con la ayuda de su esposo. La actividad que realiza Doris consiste en la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso abrió una bodega en su casa.  También   se dedica a la venta de vestuario policial, la confecciona en su pequeño taller, que se encuentra instalado en su propia casa, es así que este trabajo lo prepara previamente por pedido de sus clientes. Se inició en éste negocio gracias al poder relacionarse en el ambiente policial, ya que su esposo es policía en actividad, haciéndose de esta manera muy conocida  y solicitada por el buen acabado de sus trabajos, dedicándose a ésta actividad  hace más de 05 años, y realzándola sola.
Tiene planes de poder ampliar su bodega y aumentar su stock de mercaderías, como bebidas gasificadas, golosinas y otros productos comestibles. Este sería el  préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal, y desea poder seguir contando con este apoyo, seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más prestamos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de productos para abastecer su bodega, asimismo en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Doris, 40, is a cheerful, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Armando who is a police officer.  She has a 12-year-old son.  They are the greatest gifts life has given her.  She lives in a pretty house she managed to build with her husband’s help.  

Doris’ activity is selling basic staples; to do so she opened a store at home.  She also sells police uniforms that she manufactures in her small workshop also located at home.  She does this work based on prior customer orders.  She started in this business thanks to being involved in the police environment since her husband is a police officer in active duty.  She’s become very well-known and sought-after because of the fine finishing touches she puts into her work.  She’s been doing this work for five years and she does it alone.

She plans to enlarge the store and increase her stock of merchandise like soft-drinks, snacks and other food items.  This would be her 5th MFP loan and she feels good with the work in her communal bank and wants to continue counting on this support.  She will continue to be punctual with her payments to have good credit history and be able to access more loans.  She will use the entire requested 3,000 new soles to buy products to stock her store as well as articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao, se dedica a la venta de calzado, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos quienes están estudiando bachillerato, tiene un puesto de venta de calzado en el centro de la ciudad, tiene 5 años de experiencia, realiza las ventas junto a su esposa quien le ayuda, trabajan de lunes a domingo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos para dama, en variedad de estilos y colores, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios para aprovechar que se acerca una temporada de mayor demanda.
La aspiración de Estanislao es fortalecer mas el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao, 43, makes a living selling footwear.  He lives with his wife and they have two children who are undertaking academic studies.  He sells shoes in a stall downtown.  He has five years of experience.  His wife helps him sell; they work from Monday through Sunday.

He's requesting a loan to buy women's shoes in a variety of colors and styles.  This purchase will help him increase his inventory to take advantage of the demand of the season.

Estanislao's goal is to strengthen his business more so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Dúo Esmeralda Group

texts.es: Dúo Esmeralda. Este Dúo esta integrado por la señora Ernestina Graciela,es madre y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad la cual asiste a la escuela de la comunidad donde ella vive, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos se dedica a esta activdad desde hace 4 años, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta ya que se viene la epoca de fin de año entonces es cuendo mas se vende espera que le puedan ayudr con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Ernestina Graciela is part of Dúo Esmeralda. She is a mother, and has a daughter who is seven years old. Her daughter goes to the school in her local community. Ernestina sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for four years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell, as the end of the year is approaching and this is when sales are highest. She hopes that you can help with her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Josehpine

texts.en:
Josehpine is single, 24 years old, and lives in Airport with a six-year-old child who lives at home and attends school.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. 

She likes her business because she can save money every day. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old, single, and has no dependents. He sells used clothes and shoes, a business he started three years ago. He earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. He wants to purchase bales of shoes and clothes to resell; therefore he has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES. 

The profit he makes from his business will help him repay the loan and expand his business. His dream is to own a business empire.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of hardworking women. Esther is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Esther has been working hard to manage her drugstore, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used both to acquire more medicine to run Esther's pharmacy better and to help Esther generate greater profits to sustain her family. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her drugstore. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to acquire more medicine to run a pharmacy better.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 35000 through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers.

NWTF is listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy Manka'a

texts.en:
Dorothy Manka'a is married and lives with her husband and six children at Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. 

This woman has faced so many challenges in life including the death of her sister after lying in the hospital for several months, so that all her money was spent in the hospital.  After her sister's death, she could not provide three square meals to her family.  Thieves also stole her goods in the market,  leaving her with no capital to continue her business. She was sick for several months, and could not pay for her medication due to inadequate finances.

Dorothy Manka'a joined GHAPE in the year 2003, and has taken out and successfully repaid her loans five times. She promises that with the new loan requested, she will buy more food ingredients for her restaurant business like vegetable oil, flour, beans, koki beans, rice, tomatoes, onions and Maggi. She thinks this business will succeed because her business is situated near a school, where students buy from her during breaks.  She sells puff puff, which people buy and eat alongside tea for breakfast.  Her food is in high demand in that locality because of scarcity of restaurants. 

With this business activity, the community members will not travel long distances in search food.  She also educates the community on how to prepare good food so that they can also engage in the business.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay her children's school fees and provide their basic educational needs like text books, pens, pencils and exercise books.  She will also take care of her family's health and plough back into the business.  A GHAPE loan is preferable to her because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and no collateral security before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, flour, beans, koki beans, rice, tomatoes, onions and Maggi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients, tables and chairs for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Hajara has been working hard to manage her soft drink business. She sells lemonade and other soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get more types of drinks to be sold and will help Hajara to generate greater profits so that she can better look after her mother. Hajara hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income. 

Hajara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To get more types of drinks to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro tiene la edad de 40 años es casado tiene 2 hijos el trabaja como operario y su esposa también ambos comparten los gastos de la vivienda como también los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, en esta ocasión esta el apoyo  de esta institución para instalar la tubería del drenaje para poder tener un baño propio en su hogar ya que no cuentan con ningún baño en su hogar, la familia  podrá tener mas higiene y la comodidad de un baño en su vivienda, desea contar con el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Both he and his wife work as operators. They share the household expenses, as well as the education expenses for their children. 

At this time, he is requesting the support of this institution so he can install drainage piping in his home, so that they can have their own bathroom as there currently isn't one. With a bathroom in their home, his family will have better hygiene and will be more comfortable. He would like to have the support of Kiva.

loans.use: to install plumbing in the bathroom.

loans.name: Paxoj Huitan Group

texts.es:
La señora Maura Aracely es madre soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al cuidado y crianza de cerdos, para luego venderlos cuando sean grandes, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su familia y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y así tener mejor ganancias cuando los venda, espera en el futuro tener cerditos pequeños. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la tejeduría, crianza de animales, y a la atención de una farmacia.
texts.en:
Maura Aracely is 28-year-old single mother. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has four children, two of which are studying. She makes a living taking care of and raising pigs, to later sell them when they are big. She started this business with the support of her family and now has eight years of experience. She has the support of her husband who makes a living from agriculture.

She organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy pigs, in that way making a better profit when she sells them. She hopes to have piglets in the future. 

The other members of the group make a living from weaving, raising animals and working in a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 45 year old widowed woman, who has four children. She is a resident of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Zenaida plants, harvests, and sells coconuts in order to make a living. With 19 years in this business, each month she earns 29,980 PHP. Zenaida requested for a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She joined GDMPC in 2011 to seek guidance and assistance. 

Positively, she hopes to progress in her business to supplement her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Adankpeji Group

texts.en:
‘Adankpeji’ is a group of three women who are fish sellers. All three women are married; two have children and one has no child. They have been together since 2009 and meet on Thursdays to discuss business.  


Gifty is 38 years old and married to a 48 year old draughtsman called Daniel. They have two children. She is a fish seller and has been taking loans from ID Ghana since 2010. She has been selling fish for 11 years now. She is a very business minded person, who needs finance to operate a mini cold store in her area. Customers in her area have to go about 300 meters to buy fish from the cold store. She wants to explore this business opportunity and make maximum profit.

This is her fifth loan, and she will need financial support of GHS 1,500 to stock her cold store with fish. She has been making a monthly profit of GHS 100, which she invests back into the business.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 4,400 to be able to buy more goods for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Abadahemuka C12064 Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 60 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 4 and 19 years old. Emmanuel's business is selling various goods such as beans, potatoes, rice, etc.. Emmanuel has 10 years of experience and he works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day per week except on Saturday. 

Emmanuel is the leader of a group which is called "ABADAHEMUKA C12064" in the local language. In the photo, Emmanuel is the one who is raising his hand. Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as beans, potatoes, rice, etc. for resale. If successful, he will be able to save money for his future, to get more food for his family, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as beans, potatoes, rice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, married to Charles, and blessed with four children, aged 13, 10, 8 and 6 years. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started three years ago, and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES. 

Ruth has requested a second loan, of 20,000 KES, to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and hopes to become a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Nelson Raul

texts.es: Nelson vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Tiene 36 años de edad está casado tiene 1 hijo de 7 años que asiste a una escuela fiscal.La falta de empleo en el país lo llevo a  tomar  la decisión de trabajar como maestro albañil. En la actualidad Nelson trabaja por contrato. El hace paredes, loza, pisos. Nelson trabaja cuando lo contratan desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.Con el préstamo quiere comprar picos, cascos, cemento etc. Su meta es tener una propia empresa en la que se venda materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in Las Orquídeas, an area north of the city of Guayaquil. He is 36 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son who attends a state school. Due to the lack of jobs in the country, Nelson made the decision to work on his own as a master bricklayer. He currently works on a contract basis. He builds walls, installs tiles, and lays down floors. Whenever he has a contract, he works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M.

With this loan, Nelson will buy picks, safety helmets, cement, and other supplies. His goal is to have his own business in which he sells construction materials.

loans.use: to buy picks, safety helmets, cement, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is from Maguikay, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old and married, with 3 children. To make a living, Mary Ann cultivates coconut for sale. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a married woman who has five children. She is 49 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Merlyn owns and operates a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business venture to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Merlyn wants to make improvements to her house and expand/improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 32-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for two years. He started the business to supplement his meager salary as a government worker. Like most traders in a developing country, he faces challenges of price fluctuation and high taxes. Despite these challenges, he has dreams of owning a wholesale shop and buying land to grow crops. Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, soda, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soda, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Oreke

texts.en: Oreke, who is 33, lives in West Point with her husband and four children. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 15, and are currently in school. Oreke has a cook shop (restaurant) in her community where she has been selling food for the past five years. She sells six days a week, and prepares cassava leaf, potato grains, fufu and soup to meet her customers' desires. She makes a profit when she sells because of the good service she renders to her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the business. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 38-year-old, married man, who has three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years he has been a security guard, working with a private security company in the country. His inspiration is derived from the desire to protect the people, after he suffered the loss of his relatives during the rebel insurgency in 2001. After realizing that the meager salary he earns cannot meet his basic needs and those of his family, he set up a retail shop. His desire is to educate his children up to the university and to own a wholesale shop. Jacob is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 42 years old and married; she has four children. Three of her children are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a variety store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF, to purchase more grocery items to resell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Isidro and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosario operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Rosario also sells ice cream. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosario is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosario dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 24 years old. He lives in Khoni District with his mother and brother. The family runs a small dairy business of a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell their dairy products locally. Mamuka has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programs extend business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor. These families do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Mamuka will purchase grapes and sugar to produce wine. After the products are purchased, the family will be able to sell a good quality wine at a high price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Mamuka awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase grapes and sugar for producing wine

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona's group is comprised of hard-working women. Phiona is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Phiona has been working hard to manage her soft drinks business, which sells lemonade and juice. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more lemonade and juice for resale, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and to pay fees for her younger brother. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more lemonade and juice for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has had a grocery shop for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, bread, tea leaves and cooking oil. She sells on a retail basis and works six days a week. She works at the market. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked grocery shop and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bread, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 41-year-old, married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 4. 

Gaudiosa is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets and earns 2,400 pesos a month by doing the basket weaving. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase buri (palm) wicker- it is a hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Gaudiosa would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to support her family and at the same time to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (palm) wicker

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen, 56, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Carmen also sells ice cream. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Carmen is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Carmen simply wants to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por diversas razones Aníbal se separó de su esposa, desde entonces él es padre y madre para su pequeña, Aníbal no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Aníbal trabaja como obrera en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus labores, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que tiene hacia los demás.
Aníbal se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar el pago de inscripción, matricula y compra del uniforme escolar de su pequeña; de esta manera Aníbal podrá brindarle una mejor educación ya que la esta trasladando a un nuevo colegio, que tiene un nivel mayor de educación, así pues él desea lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeña hija convertida en una bue a profesional y en una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 45, lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district with his young daughter, whom he loves and who is his main motivation in life.  He's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his effort to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, for a variety of reasons Aníbal separated from his wife.  Since then he has been both father and mother to his little girl.  Aníbal wasn't able to study for a professional career because he had to work from a young age, but he would like to have been able to.

With a lot of effort and dedication Aníbal works in a company in his city.  Every day he starts work very early, working approximately 10 hours a day.  He believes it's going well for him because he's responsible and treats others well.

Aníbal is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to pay for his daughter's enrollment, registration, and school uniform.  This way he'll give her a better education, because he's transferring her to another school that has a higher academic level.

He hopes to achieve his dream of seeing his little girl become a good professional and a good woman.

loans.use: to cover his daughter's school expenses

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco is a 32-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After realizing the need for more capital to live a modest life, he started a motorcycle spare-parts shop. His personal goals are buying a plot and building a good residential house. His business plan is diversifying the business to include motor vehicle spare parts. John Bosco is requesting for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She owns a cereals store and has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase five bags of dry maize and beans for resale.  

The anticipated amount will be used to repay the loan and diversify to another business. She hopes to own a retail shop and educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of dry maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nfonika Veronica

texts.en:
She is married and has four children, one of them below 15 years of age. The family lives in a three-room apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life, among which are the death of one of her family members, illness, and inadequate capital to start up a business. 
 
She plans to use the loan she requested as follows: Buy coca yams in bags, buy palm oil in tins, buy fish in bulk. Also, part of the loan will be used to invest in all the spices that will be used in cooking the food. She believes that her restaurant business will succeed, because she has being cooking and selling food for a long time. Her existing, regular customers provide an available market for her food. Also, the increasing number of schools in the town of Bamenda greatly act as a market for prepared food, which is another reason to expect the business to succeed. From this restaurant business, the community will be able to consume good-quality, always-ready cooked food. They also will not need to go long distances to buy cooked food.
 
With the profit from the loan, she will educate her children, pay rent for their home, and provide all the basic needs for her children, like medical care.   She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates on loans and the training that is given by GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy coca yams, palm oil, fish, and spices, for cooking meals.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married to Paul and blessed with two children, ages 15 and 10 years, respectively. Irene runs a retail shop, a business she started 4 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

Irene has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase 10 bales of baking flour, cooking oil, five sacks of sugar and two sacks of rice.

The profit earned from the business will help her save and buy a matatu (a mini-bus for public transportation). Her dream is to see this business grow into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of baking flour, cooking oil, five sacks of sugar and two sacks of rice.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 42-year-old, married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for 21 years and with the income earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. Wilson also sells secondhand clothes so as to supplement his farming activities which are seasonal. 

Wilson suffered the loss of his plantation when there was an outbreak of banana wilt disease in the country coupled with soil erosion due to the torrential rains, thus leading to poor yields this year. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy manure for his banana plantation.

His dreams are educating his children up to the university and rehabilitating his banana plantation through modern farming methods since farming has always been his major source of income.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 34, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danny, a farmer, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alma is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Alma also sells different vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Alma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alma dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fish and vegetables that she sells to customers.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Kotognogotala ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe  décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Mélanie (1 ère debout avec un foulard jaune) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 paquets de maggi 1 boite de concentrée de tomate, 1/2 sac de sel de cuisine et une grande quantité de condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de KIMPARANA et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Mélanie  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 7000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mainly in traditional extended families, the seven women in the group Kotognogotala have a mean age of 36 years and an average of four children. They all live in the village of Niazekan in the region of Ségou (located in the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, commerce and kinship. Their main business is the sale of vegetable-based sauces.

In order to satisfy the demands of their ever-growing clientele, the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently on their first group loan cycle.

Mélanie (shown standing on the far left and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo) is a superior sauce-maker. She is very sought after as a businesswoman. Mélanie plans to use her loan to purchase three packets of Maggi (a brand of bouillon base), one carton of tomato paste, half a sack of cooking salt, and a large number of sauce vegetables. She purchases her supplies from the market in Kimparana and sells her goods for cash at retail to a diverse and varied clientele.

With this loan, Mélanie hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 7,000 FCFA. She will use this income to reinvest in her business and to help her husband in paying for their household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase the supplies to make vegetable-based sauces for selling.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 44-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is twenty-four and the youngest is nine. She is engaged in food vending. She sells snack foods and fruit juice to the nearby school. She has been in the food vending business for five years. Aside from food vending, she raises pigs.

She has requested a loan of 4,000PHP to buy more merchandise like fruit juice, feed for her pigs and additional piglets. In the future, Paz would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures to support her family and at the same time send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruit juice, feed and piglets.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 30 years old and an active and diligent, married woman. She is a responsible mother of two sons, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband is a hard-working taxi driver. She faced a really difficult time, because her husband's income is inadequate to provide for his family. So, to help her husband, Shabana initiated a hand-embroidery business in 2010, because she knew she had excellent embroidery skills. Her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. She serves her customers well and gets a lot of appreciation from them.

To continue her business and to respond to the increasing demand of customers, Shabana wants to purchase a variety of embroidery materials, like beads, hoops, and thread in various colors. To do that, she has requested a loan as a member of a six-person group, from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She dreams of providing the best education to her children, so from her profit she will put aside some savings, for their higher education expenses. 

Note: In the picture, the borrower named Yasmeen is shown with her children (a daughter and a son). And Shabana is holding a pass book in her hands.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials such as beads, hoops and thread in many colors, to continue developing her embroidery business.

loans.name: Izoldi

texts.en:
Izoldi is 45 years old and from a small village of the Gurjaani district, East Georgia. She lives with her 49-year-old husband and her two sons (20- and 15-years-old). Her husband works as a brick-layer and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 45 persimmon roots; they harvest them and sell them locally. 

Izoldi has a 0.20 hectare vineyard and she produces Churchkhela (traditional sausage-shaped candies; the main ingredients are grape must, nuts and flour) and sells them in the village at the local open market. She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business.

Izoldi has requested a loan to purchase a stock of nuts for her Churchkhela. After the stock of nuts is purchased, she will be able to produce more Churchkhela and increase her sales. This will significantly increase the income of her family and thus, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Izoldi awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a shock of nuts to make more Churchkhela to sell.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is a single yet business-oriented man. He is 29 years of age and living with his auntie. Ariel is a farmer and at the same time a hog-raiser within his local community. By this time, he manages his half hectare of a corn field and raises three hogs to be fattened for sale. 

He planed to buy four piglets and some hog feed, but due to insufficient funds he is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP25,000. He knows that this loan will keep his business growing continuously and make it more profitable because he always sees to it that he provides the necessary hog feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and more livestock feed for his hog-raising.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is 53 years old, married and has two children. He is from Nablus.
He has a bachelor's degree and has owned a blacksmith shop since 2000.
Imad has asked Ryada for this loan to buy a welding machine, electrical scissors, and a grinding machine.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, electrical scissors, and a grinding machine..

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
María Fermina es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos menores. Tiene casa propia en la que vive con su familia en el sector Monteverde, en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope. Su comunidad cuenta aproximadamente con 150 familias.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales una vez alcanzado su peso y talla ideal, los vende en el mercado local. Las dos actividades mencionadas las realiza en su domicilio, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de labores en agricultura.

Su bodega es de mucha ayuda para sus vecinos ya que, debido a que la zona en la que residen se encuentra lejos del pueblo central, su negocio les provee de los artículos de primera necesidad que necesitan.

Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un crédito brindado a través de Kiva, se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2300 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros artículos de primera necesidad, para implementar su bodega, así como en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
María Fermina, 40, is a married woman with two minor children.  She has a house of her own and lives with her family in the Monteverde sector, a rural zone in Mórrope District.  Her community has approximately 150 families.

Her activity is selling groceries at home and raising animals to sell; when they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the local market.  She does both mentioned activities at home and has more than three years’ experience in the line of work.  She earns extra income working in agriculture.

Her store is of much benefit to her neighbors because the zone they live in is far from the main town and her store provides basic staples they need.

She’s worked with a Kiva loan previously and she’s quite grateful to the people who supported her on that occasion.  She’s currently requesting a 2,300 new sol loan to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, oil and other basic staples to stock her store and also to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her stor and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Reneh

texts.en: Reneh, 54 years old, is a married woman and resident of Lebanon. With her husband and three adorable children, she decided to carry on her life despite some difficult circumstances. At this time, she’s cooperating with her husband and expecting a shiny future for their children. Reneh decided to start her own business in 1995. She’s specialized in knitting handmade table covers. Her husband is a carpenter working at a local company. She wants to better develop her business and improve her work as well. She decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added yarn and other knitting supplies that can speed up her work and make it much easier. This Kiva loan will also allow her to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve her income by minimum of 20 percent. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality and expand her profession.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and other supplies for knitting

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, two attending school. Three years ago, she started her own business of shop keeping on a small scale. She sells various goods of daily use such as soaps, lotions and grocery items in her general store. Samina operates from 8 a.m. till 10 p.m. every day except Sundays. Her son assists her in his free time so she can manage to perform house activities as well.  

She has gradually improved her business and now she has requested a loan of Rs.10000 to buy more packs of cleaning products and beverages. This will enable her to cater to more customers time after time.  She dreams to renovate her house and build another room for her children.

loans.use: to buy more packs of cleaning products and beverages.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 35 years old and married with two children. His two children are still studying. Rodolfo is engaged in the hog-raising and farming business. He has run his hog-raising business for one year. Rodolfo would like to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock and plans to prepare his corn farm plot so he can ensure proper care of his corn farming business.

To make his goal attainable, he is borrowing a loan of PHP40,000. He believes this will keep his hogs healthier and fatter because he will sustain them with proper nutrition upon reaching their optimum growth. He just hopes that the lenders will continue to support him financially so he can educate his two children and improve his financial status.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs and prepare the land of his corn field.

loans.name: Nancy Yanine

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven madre de familia que reside junto a su menor hija en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizada principalmente por producir frutas como el mango, las cuales son exportadas a otros países. La zona pertenece a la región Piura y actualmente cuenta solo con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Ella se ha dedicado desde hace varios años a la venta itinerante de prendas de vestir y gracias a otros créditos financiados a través de Kiva anteriormente pudo ampliar su negocio hacia la venta de artículos confeccionados en plástico. Actualmente cuenta con bastante clientela establecida en la zona debido al empeño que le ha puesto a las labores que realiza.

Recientemente fue contratada por un fundo de la zona especializado en el cultivo de frutas para exportación en donde trabaja como operaria. Ella trabaja por las mañanas en este lugar y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio original.

Nancy se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le han ayudado en anteriores oportunidades a través de Kiva y, debido a la buena experiencia por la que paso, se encuentra solicitando nuevamente un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir y artículos de plástico con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio.

Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Nancy is a young mother living with her minor daughter in one of the settlements that make up the rural zone of Tambogrande District, a tropical zone noted primarily for growing mangoes that are exported to other countries.  The zone belongs to the Piura Region and currently only has electricity.

She’s been working selling clothes from place to place for several years and thanks to other previous loans financed through Kiva she was able to expand the business into selling plastic ware.  She currently has quite a large clientele in the zone thanks to the effort she’s put into the work she does.

She was recently hired by a large agricultural estate specializing in fruit production where she works as a laborer.  She works mornings in this place and spends afternoons in her original business.

Nancy is very grateful to people who have helped her through Kiva in past occasions and because of the good experience she had she’s now asking for a 2,000 new sol loan to buy more articles of clothing and plastic ware she can use to expand her business with.  She gives thanks in advance to all the people who will support her on this occasion.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and plastic items to expand the business.

loans.name: Dina Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señorita Dina del Rosario esta soltera, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó su estudio como secretaria de oficina, actualmente se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa: chumpas, playeras, camisas, pañuelos, etc. inicio este negocio gracias a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la venta, consistente en Chumpas para así tener mas posibilidades de tener mas ventas y ganancias. En el futuro espera tener una venta mayor.
texts.en: Dina del Rosario’s single.  She’s 25-years-old and studied to become an office secretary.  She currently works in commerce selling clothes like sweaters, t-shirts, shirts, handkerchiefs, etc.  She started this business thanks to her family and to date has five years’ experience.  She’s requesting a loan that she’ll use to buy merchandise consisting of sweaters to sell and thus have more sales and profit possibilities.  She hopes her future sales will be higher.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. Florence owns a sewing business and also sells various goods such as: Fanta, cakes, sugar, etc that she operates from her work from 6 a.m until 5 p.m every day each week, except on the weekend. She currently employs one person to help her and she has two years of experience in this business. 

Florence has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy some goods for her store like: Fanta, cakes, sugar, etc and to buy some materials and machines for her sewing to get more profits. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy some goods for her store like Fanta, cakes, sugar, etc and to buy some materials and machines for her sewing business to get more profits.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling firewood for the last six years and also does farming. She hopes to build a house, educate her children and expand her business to new areas despite challenges of inadequate capital to meet the demand. She says that if she had enough money, she would diversify to other fuel sources such as cook stoves and solar, which has no negative impact on the environment. Oliver intends to use the loan facility to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick manages his 1-hectare corn field and a livestock business. He has operated his livestock business for three years. Roderick is married with three children. While he is busy cultivating his corn farm, his wife also enjoys feeding his hogs. They work together to gain a good income for the family's well being, children's education and have a comfortable living condition.

Roderick is now seeking additional working capital of PHP 19,000 that would allow him to buy necessary feed. Some of the loan amount will be used for land preparation of his corn field. He believes that his business will further grow because of his patience and determination in life.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed and for land preparation of his corn field.

loans.name: Soledad Yesenia

texts.es:
Soledad es una joven de 23 años vive al lado de sus padres a quienes apoya mucho en la ciudad de Pisco, soledad es una joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio y le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser enfermera. Día a día Soledad trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 hora sal día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes.

Soledad está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz pro sacos, azúcar al por mayor, fideos, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y poder seguir esforzándose por  conseguir lograr su mas grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y tener otro negocio”.
texts.en:
Soledad is a young woman who's 23 years old. She lives in the town of Pisco with her parents, to whom she provides much support. Soledad is a very cheerful young woman with a great deal of drive to get ahead. In her free time, she very much enjoys playing volleyball with her neighbors and friends from her neighborhood. She also loves to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken). Because of her scarce financial resources, she could only study up to the fifth grade of middle school. However, she would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.
Soledad works everyday on her small business of selling groceries. She works about 10 hours a day and may serve up to 10 customers a day. She believes that her business is doing well because she's friendly towards the customers.
Soledad is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she'll be able to purchase merchandise for her business such as sacks of rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, etc. That way she'll have a wider variety of products to offer. She'll also be able to keep on working hard in order to accomplish her biggest dream: finishing the construction of her house with noble materials and owning another business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business such as sacks of rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Lourdes vive en una comunidad donde la gente habla la lengua mazahua, cuenta que tiene 36 años de edad por el momento está viviendo en unión libre con el señor Carlos juntos han formado una familia con sus cuatro hijos que van a la escuela anteriormente doña Lourdes ya habia estado en uno grupo grande esta vez ha solicitado un crédito individual para invertirlo en su negocio de venta y compra de pollos  vivos y muertos ya que tienen un pedido demasiado grande y cree no poder con todo el gasto platica que con el crédito comprara mas pollos y algunos duces ya que además del negocio de la venta de pollos también tiene una tienda de abarrotes pero además hace comida para los maestros que se encuentran dando clases en la comunidad, la cantidad no sabe porque comprar poco poco. Doña Lourdes lleva ya 7 años en su negocio ella comprar el pollo vivo a un menor precio para luego venderlo ella a domicilio a un precio más alto ya casi siempre tiene muchos pedido ya está en casa o en las localidades más cercanas. Platica que inicio su negocio porque quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para poder mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y su familia, sin embrago la dificultad más grande a la que se presenta doña Lourdes es cuando no hay ningún evento y casi no hay ventas y peor aun si encargo muchos pollos se quedaran ahí sin vender, pero esto no la desanima ya que sabe que si hoy no vendió mañana le irá mejor. Una de las metas de doña Lourdes es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia más que nada para mejorar la educación de sus hijos quiere que terminen una carrera para que tengan una mejor vida. Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con el crédito ya que con sus ganancias podrá comprarles zapatos, alimento, ropa a los niños.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in a community where the people speak the language Mazahua. She is 36 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Carlos. Together they have formed a family with their four children who go to school.

Previously, Lourdes was in a large group. This time, she has asked for an individual loan to invest in her business selling live and butchered chickens, as they have an order too big and she believes she can’t cover the expenses, so she says with the loan she will buy more chickens and also some sweets to sell in her chicken business.
