She also has a grocery store but also makes food for the teachers who are giving classes in the community. She doesn’t know the amount because she buys little by little.

Lourdes has been in the business seven years buying live chickens at a low price and later selling them from home at a higher price and almost always she has many orders from home or in the nearby communities.

She says that she began her business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve the quality of life for her and her family. However, the biggest difficulty that Lourdes faces is when there is no activity, and almost no sales, and even worse when she has many chickens not sold, but this does not discourage her as she knows that if not sold today, tomorrow will be better.

One of Lourdes goals is to improve the quality of life for her and her family and more than anything to improve the education of her children who she wants to finish school in order to have a better life. She is very happy and grateful for the loan as with her earnings she can buy shoes, food, and clothing for the children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and sweets for her business, selling from home and in the nearby communities

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, por diversas razones Angelina se separó de su esposo desde hace muchos años, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madres para sus hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que tiene muchos deseos por salir adelante; lamentablemente Angelina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angelina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Angelina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como gaseosas, agua mineral, cervezas, entre otros; de esta manera Angelina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Angelina is a 51-year-old woman living in the city of Pucallpa.  She has two adult children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  For various reasons, Angelina separated from her husband many years ago and since then she’s been both father and mother to her children.  She’s a very kind, hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Unfortunately, Angelina was unable to study nursing because she had to go to work very young but she would have loved to have done so.  In her free time she enjoys spending pleasant time with her family and sometimes cooks a delicious Chicken with Rice to pamper them with.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angelina works in her small business selling beverages.  She starts work every day very early in the morning and can work up to 12 hours daily.  She thinks she does well because of the good prices she offers her customers.

Angelina is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy merchandise like soft-drinks, mineral water and beer, among others for her business.  In this way, Angelina will have the business well-stocked and will be able to increase sales and income this way that will help her to gradually expand the business and become a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Zuliyata's Group

texts.en:
Zuliyata's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Zuliyata is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zuliyata has been working hard to manage her fruit business which sells fruits. 

To help expand her business, Zuliyata has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get other varieties of fruits to sell and will help Zuliyata to generate greater profits and support her family. Zuliyata hopes that in the future she will be able to get her business to grow. 

Zuliyata is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to get other varieties of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efrain esta soltero, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educacion primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo gracia al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia,.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos en la elaboración de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener una mejor producción, empleados, y así seguir apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en: Efraín, 48, is single.  He completed elementary school and works as a weaver.  He started this work thanks to support from his parents and to date has six years’ experience.  he requests a loan to buy supplies for his work. He hopes in future to produce more, hire staff and continue supporting his parents.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in the Malindi area of Coast province in Kenya. She is married and a mother of four children that attend school.  She owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for ten years. In this business, Martha sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals etc. She also has rental houses.
Martha learned about Milango through a friend and joined in hopes of obtaining credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are bad debts and lack of enough capital to expand her business.  She feels this issue will be helped in part by this new application/loan.
Martha is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables in wholesale and retail stock of e.g. soap, sugar etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children's school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy vegetable in wholesale and retail stock of e.g. soap, sugar etc.

loans.name: Ciria Eufemia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Ciria, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, uno ya es mayor y tres de 16, 11 y 9  de edad los  mismos que estudian  dos en colegio y el menor en escuela, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es trabajador municipal.

Doña Ciria tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, además de ciertos productos de basar y papelería que hace poco surtió y que también le está dejando buenos beneficios, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados de sus tareas. Tiene su tienda por más de 13  años y  fue con el primer crédito que hizo que empezó con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y ciertos artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 13 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a location where people for the most part work in agriculture, animal husbandry and selling their products.  Ciria, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has four children.   One of them is an adult already and the other three are 16, 11 and 9 years of age.  The older two attend secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  All of them still live with her and her husband is a municipal employee.

Ciria has a store at home where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among other things.  She also sells certain kitchen items and stationery supplies she stocked recently and which are also producing good profits.  She works every day from 6am until 9pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her when they aren’t busy with homework.  She’s had the store for more than 13 years and used her initial loan to start it.

She’s going to use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and certain kitchen items.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 13 years and likes it because she started her business with her initial loan.  Her goals are to stay in business so that it will grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, con 5 hijos con carga familiar directa, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. Su vivienda se encuentra situada en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona de Lambayeque, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50 familias.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Los ingresos que obtienen de estas actividades le sirven para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Adicionalmente cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de actividades relacionadas a la agricultura

El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos y pavos para su posterior venta en navidad.
texts.en:
Valentín, 39, is married and has five children who are dependent on him.  He lives in his own house with his family.  His house is located in one of the settlements making up the Lambayeque zone; it’s a small community of about 50 families.

The activity he carries out is raising and selling animals.  He’s been doing this for ten years.  The business is home-based.  He learned it from his parents, that is, he knows it to perfection.  Income earned from these activities are used to cover family expenses.  He has competition but he also has a wide market to sell in.  In addition, he earns extra income from tasks related to agriculture.

He’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan to buy pigs and turkeys to sell later for Christmas.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 44 years old and a single parent with three children between the ages of 12 and 20. Two of the children stay with her in Airport, while the other child lives with his father.  For the past six years she has been selling imported ladies' blouses and dresses at the general market. She earns a profit because she sells items made from quality material and has a good interaction with her customers. She has requested a loan to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and dresses.  She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and dresses.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin plans to improve the weight of his raised hogs to earn greater income.  But due to shortage of capital, he is seeking a loan amounting to PHP30,000.  This loan amount will be utilized by buying necessary feed and vitamins.  Some of it will be used for land preparation on his corn farm. 

Agustin is married and has been blessed with four children.  Three of his children are studying while his youngest child is still an infant.  He is thankful because his wife is supportive in making his corn field and hog raising business more profitable and a viable source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and to pay for maintenance of his corn farming business

loans.name: Marita Rosario

texts.es:
Marita tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos dependientes, vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en una de las comunidades rurales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical que se ha hecho conocida por dedicarse a exportar diversas frutas a otros países. Se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas y al alquiler de cabinas de internet, hace aproximadamente más de 2 años en un local que tiene acondicionado en su domicilio. Ella atiende al público todos los días y actualmente cuenta con clientela establecida siendo bastante conocida en la zona. Los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Marita se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc. para surtir su bodega.

Ella agradece de antemano a los prestamistas de Kiva que le apoyen en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Marita is 36 years old and married. She has three children who are independent. She lives with her husband and her underage children in one of the rural communities that comprise the rural district of Tambogrande. It's an area of tropical climate and it's known for exporting various types of fruit to other countries. It's located in the region of Piura.
Her business is selling groceries, beverages and snacks, and renting out internet booths. She has done this for over two years approximately, in a store she has set up in her house. She opens everyday and she currently has a well-established clientele. She's very well-known in the area. She uses the profits she gets from her business to help her husband support their family's finances.
Marita is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. It is for 700 nuevos soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, olive oil, etc., in order to stock up her grocery store.
She gives thanks in advance to Kiva lenders for supporting her at this time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, olive oil, etc., in order to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es:
Mitzy, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Carlos quien es empleado y padre de su único hijo Fabrizzio de 3 años de edad. Vive en compañía de su esposo, y su pequeño hijo, a los que quiere mucho, habitando su casa propia que lograron comprar gracias a bastante esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Mitzy es la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con una boutique que logró abrir en un espacio que acondiciono en su propia casa, de ésta manera  ahorra gastos de alquiler, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Ésta actividad la realiza hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento se dedica ella sola.
Le gusta  su actividad el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de empleado en una empresa privada, así como contar con tiempo libre para atender a su pequeño hijo.  Se siente a gusto al hacer lo que le gusta, y  sentirse una pequeña empresaria. Lo considera rentable por que ha logrado ganarse cliente regular y el tener una regular demanda, hace que cuente con ingresos permanentes, tiene planes de abrir otro negocio de venta de parrillas y comidas los sábados y domingos en sociedad con su madre. Este sería el  préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo de la institución, desea poder seguir contando con este apoyo, seguirá siendo puntual en sus pagos, así poder tener acceso a más préstamos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos  soles, lo invertirá la mitad en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos traídos desde la capital,  y la otra mitad lo usará como capital de trabajo para su nuevo negocio de parrillas.
texts.en:
Mitzy, 27, is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She's married to Carlos, who's an employee and the father of her only child, Fabrizzio, age 3.  She lives with her husband and her young son, whom she loves a lot, in her own house, which they managed to buy with a lot of effort.

Mitzy's work is selling women's clothing and accessories in a boutique she opened in a space she set up in her house (so she saves on rent), where she very pleasantly waits on all her customers.  She has done this work for more than three years and up to the present she works alone.  She likes her work and being able to have an income to help her husband with the household expenses.  Sometimes his salary as an employee of a private business isn't enough.  She also likes to be able to have free time to take care of her young son.

She's comfortable doing what she likes, and she feels like a small business entrepreneur.  She considers it profitable because she has managed to attract regular customers and have regular demand, which gives her permanent income.  She plans to open another business, selling grilled food with her mother on Saturday and Sunday.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She's happy to be able to have the institution's help.  She wants to be able to continue having this support.  She'll continue being punctual with her payments so she'll have access to more loans.

With the requested loan of 3000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll use half to buy various styles of clothing in the capital and the other half as working capital for her new grilled food business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments

loans.name: Isaias Smith

texts.es:
Isaías es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus familia, Isaías se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en alguna de estas ocasiones aprovechan la oportunidad para comer unos deliciosos Chicharrones de Chincha.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Isaías trabaja como obrero en una empresa de construcción de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Isaías se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual utilizará para brindar servicios de transporte; de esta manera Isaías espera poder generar mayor ingresos económicos, los cuales le servir de mucho para poder culminar sus estudios profesionales, así pues Isaías seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Isaías, 21, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to his efforts and support from his family he’s studying a professional career.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes they take advantage of the opportunity to enjoy some delicious “Chicharrones de Chincha.” [fried pork with manioc]

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Isaías works as a laborer in a firm in his city.  He starts work every day very early and can work about 8 hours daily.  He thinks he does well because of the good way he works and the kind way he treats others.

Isaías is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a mototaxi he’ll use to provide transportation services.  In this way, Isaías hopes to generate higher income that he can use to complete his professional studies and he can continue working and striving to get ahead and reach his dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin and his wife work hard to have a stable source of income. The couple has been blessed with only one child who is currently studying. Edwin raises hogs and has for more than three years up to this time. His goal is to increase his income so he can send his child into a higher level of education and so he can have a better way of living.

Edwin would like to borrow a loan of PHP20,000 which will be used to buy three piglets and hog feed for the daily maintenance of his hog-raising business. He and his wife are thankful to the lenders for their unending financial support which they provide to make his farming and livestock more profitable and productive. He knows that his goals in life will be obtained someday.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Mery no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su madre, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mery trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de12 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mery se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas, atún, golosinas, entre otros; de esta manera Mery tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir sus sueños de tener su casa propia y un local de ventas propio en el centro de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Mery, 23, is a woman living in the city of Pisco with her life partner.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work to cover her expenses, Mery was unable to study nursing like she wanted to but she would have liked to have done so very much.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports and sometimes cooks a delicious Duck with Rice to share with her family.

Thanks to her mother’s support and with much effort and dedication, Mery works in her small business selling groceries.  She starts work every day very early and can work about 12 hours daily.  She thinks she does well because of the variety of products and the kind customer service she provides.

Mery is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a display case and merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft-drinks, tuna and snacks, among others.  In this way, Mery will have the business better-stocked and furnished.  She hopes this way to increase sales and income that will be very useful for her to gradually expand the business.  She will thus continue working and striving to reach her greatest dream of owning a house and a store of her own in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy a display case and groceries.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a twenty-eight year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle business for three years.  He started by riding someone else's motorcycle and remitting 80% of the daily earnings to the owner.   Later, he bought his own motorcycle.  High fuel costs and license fees are his major challenge.  His dream is to have land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a forty-five year old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya.  She lives with her husband and three children, who have all cleared schooling.  She has been in farming for the past seven years, producing milk, fruits and vegetables which she sells to the people around her local area.
,
She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter that will help her easily provide more feed for her dairy cows. This will  help them produce more milk and thus more income for her.  That will help her improve her standard of living.  She aspires to have built residential houses in the next five years.  Lack of a readily available market for her products is her major challenge.

Asha says  Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro finance institution for small scale farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Elsa Irene

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 49 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tubo d trabajar desde muy joven para ayuda a sus padres, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.   
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elsa puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella asiste a su puesto en un pequeño mercado de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas, Elsa puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elsa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de pisto de su habitación; de esta manera Elsa contará con un ambiente más adecuado, seguro, que le brinde mayor bienestar, así pues Elsa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y cumplir su sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 49-year-old single woman.  She lives in the city of Ica.  She's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a big desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and having to work from a young age to help her parents, she wasn't able to study to be a nurse as she would have liked.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Elsa set up her small business selling fruits.  From an early hour every day she tends her stall in a small market in the city, working approximately 12 hours a day.  She thinks it's going well for her because of the friendly service she gives her customers.

Elsa's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to improve her house.  She wants to be able to plaster, paint, and put in the floor in her room.  This way Elsa will have a suitable and safe environment that will give her greater well-being.

Elsa will continue to work and make the effort to achieve her goals and realize her dream, to finish building her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es:
Selmith, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre.  Es viuda y vive en compañía de sus tres hijos mayores de edad, más sus 05 nietos a los que quiere y engríe mucho.  Viviendo en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Selmith es la venta de ropas de diversas calidades y para todos los  gustos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, los cuales compra localmente en la ciudad  y en ocasiones trae a pedido de la capital, y los lleva  a vender en zonas alejadas de la ciudad, como caseríos ubicados a los márgenes del río, a donde realiza viajes cortos, siendo muy conocida por esas zonas, en la mayoría de los casos entrega a pedido.
Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 3 años, realizándolo en ocasiones por el apoyo y de algunos de sus hijos, que la acompañan en sus viajes por el río.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad por tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos propios y darse algunos gustos, cómprales  regalos a sus nietos. Este sería el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, espera seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2600 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros, y comprará una máquina de coser valorizada en 500 nuevos soles para incursionar en la costura, además de materiales de costura.
texts.en:
Selmith is 60 years old. She is a fighting woman, hardworking and happy. She is a widow and lives with her three adult children, plus five grandchildren whom she loves and spoils. They are living in their own home.

Selmith sells clothing of various qualities and for all tastes, both women and men, and children, which she buys locally in the city and sometimes she brings an order from the capital, and takes them to sell in remote areas of the city, including some villages located along the river, where she makes short trips, being well known in these areas, the majority of times delivering an order.

She has been in this work for more than three years, doing it sometimes with the help of some of her children, who accompany her on the river trips. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings it gives her.

She likes her work because she has an income with which she can support herself and give some pleasure to her grandchildren by buying them presents. This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She likes working with the communal bank, and hopes to continue counting on the support of the institution, promising to continue being punctual with her payments.

With the 2600 soles she has requested, she will fully invest it in buying various types of clothing and fabrics, she will buy a sewing machine valued at 500 soles in order to explore sewing, and sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy clothing and a sewing machine for her buiness

loans.name: German Salvador

texts.es:
El señor German Salvador esta soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion secundaria, se dedica actualmente a ala tejeduría, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia. 

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varias clases y colores, y si mejorar su producción de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
German Salvador is a single 24-year-old man.  He is currently in college and supports himself through the activity of weaving.  He started this business with the support of his relatives and has six years of experience.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy yarn of various types and colors, and thereby improve his production of fabrics.  He hopes to have a large business in the future and continue to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 33, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joel, and a mother to her child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mary Jane oversees the operation of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney with a capacity of 14 - 16 persons, which generates a boundary payment (a daily rental fee paid by the driver) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in her local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and to maintain the jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Jane dreams of giving her family a good life and hopes to give her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is now 49 years old and still practicing mixed crop farming. She has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 13,000 which she uses to support her family. She bought fertilizer and seedlings with the previous loan and her farm did well and made profit out of it. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Susan will use the loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for use on the farm. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will support her grandchildren. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farmed produce.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is from the Gurjaani district of the Kakheti region. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children (5 and 9 years old). The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they own a vineyard and pick the grapes in the early autumn. Also, Luiza is running an animal husbandry business and has 3 pigs. The family sells grapes and piglets at the local market. Luiza works hard to ensure a good quality harvest and takes good care of her livestock.

She has requested credit for purchasing fuel for tilling the land, in order to get a good harvest of grapes next season. Also, part of the loan will be used for purchasing pigs. Luiza will keep the pigs in the shed, located in their yard, and raise and sell them in autumn for a higher price. This will significantly increase the family income and Luiza will reinvest the increased profit in expanding her animal husbandry business. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to cultivate her land for a good grape harvest and to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese,Uganda. For four years she has been operating a restaurant and is also a farmer. She faces challenges of inflation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.

She hopes to build a permanent house for residence and expand her business to new areas. Oliver is requesting a loan to buy additional food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is 45 years old and lives with his wife in their 3-room apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has worked in a steel factory in Darkhan for 9 years. He has 2 daughters who study at the university. His wife works as a cashier in the Central Post office. Their apartment is old -- it was built in the Soviet era and needs some repairs. His daughters' education is very important to him. That’s why he paid all of his saved money for their university tuition. 

He also wants to live in a comfortable apartment. He needs to improve his living conditions. He is asking for a 5.000.000 MNT loan to set a parquet floor, double-glazed windows and to change the wallpaper.

loans.use: to set a parquet floor and double-glazed windows and to replace the wallpaper in his apartment.

loans.name: Metrine Nasimiyu

texts.en:
Metrine's baby is now a ten-month-old baby. She still runs a beauty salon and cosmetic shop which has been doing well thus her additional monthly income. She started this business six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES42,000. 

She wants to purchase hair weaves, hair oil and gels, hair conditioners and shampoo and has requested a second loan of KES60,000. She will use the profit to open more branches of her business. 

Metrine dreams of being a great entrepreneur in the future and seeing her children get the best education.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, hair oil and gels, hair conditioners and shampoos for her salon.

loans.name: Erita Argentina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Erita, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Erita es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado ganar su propio sustento a través de su trabajo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces en el centro de Calceta, trabaja junto al kiosco que tiene su marido, él se dedica a vender ricos refrescos de varios sabores, ella tiene una vitrina donde ofrece sus productos que son muy solicitados en especial por las personas que viajan a otras ciudades. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 17h00, los dulces los compra en Junín. Ella lleva más de 25 años con su negocio y le gusta porque siempre está junto a su querido esposo.

Este crédito lo va a compartir la mitad para comprar dulces para su negocio y la otra parte para el negocio de  su marido para que compre frutas y jarabe para los refrescos. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es gozar de salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga district of the city of Calceta, the majority of people work in agriculture, farming, raising animals and selling their goods in town. The Quiroga Community Bank is located in the Quiroga district, and the group members meet every 15 days.

Erita is 51 years old, and lives in Quiroga. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are now grown, and one of whom lives at home. Erita's husband is a merchant. 

Erita is a very hardworking woman who has always held a job because she likes earning her own salary and supporting her family. She makes a living operating a small business selling sweets at a stand in the city center of Calceta. Her stand is right next to her husband's stand, where he sells a wide range of refreshing beverages. Her most frequent customers are those people who are traveling to nearby cities. Erita works seven days a week, from 7:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, and she buys her merchandise in Junín. She has over 25 years of experience in her trade, and enjoys her work, especially because she gets to work alongside her beloved husband.

With the support from this loan, Erita plans to purchase merchandise to stock her business as well as her husband's business, so that he can buy syrup and fruit for making his juices and beverages.

Erita has been a member of the Community Bank for three years now, and she is grateful for the support she has received there. Her dream is to stay healthy and happy so that she can keep working.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, sweets and syrup.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 19-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents and two siblings. His youngest sibling is the one cooperating with him to cover the family’s household expenses and take some responsibilities off of their father. Khoder has owned a car-washing shop since 2008. He started his business at an early age because of the bad life conditions they experienced. He provides his customers with good services in order to build an excellent relationship with them. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added cleaning tools and supplies to expand his business, in addition to a special machine to clean wheels. He notes that this will improve his work therefore his returns. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans to develop his business and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase added cleaning tools and supplies to expand his business, in addition to a special machine to clean wheels.

loans.name: Reynald

texts.en:
Reynald is a 33-year-old married man from Albur, Bohol. He has two children, ages four and five years old respectively. He is engaged in tuba (coconut wine) vending. He has been in the tuba vending business for eight years.

He has requested a loan of 22,000 to buy empty containers or gallons and tungog (mangrove tanbark: the dried bark of a certain kind of mangrove tree). It would help the natural fermentation in producing bahal (old tuba) and the bahalina (aged tuba). Reynald would like to expand his business by investing in other ventures to support his family as well as to save for the education of his children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy empty containers or gallons and tungog (mangrove bark).

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and living with his wife, Manle, the mother of his three children who are still attending school. He is the one looking to satisfy the family needs and respond to their demands. Hussein started his own business in the year 2000. He works independently in the construction field and has more than a few projects to be accomplished. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required construction equipment in addition to a new cement machine that will allow him to carry on his work properly. Hussein is sure that in a short period of time he will be able to gain great experience and move out of the country, taking bigger projects with higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase required construction equipment in addition to a new cement machine.

loans.name: Laon

texts.en:
Laon is 45 years old and married. He supports a family of seven children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years with a monthly income of KES. 40,000. 

He is servicing his second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate the preparation of his farm and purchase of inputs. He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the farm for planting.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a 38 year old widow with two children living in Masindi –Uganda. She operates a photo studio and with the money earned she has been able support her family. She also gets an allowance since she is a political leader in her village. Her business is located on a busy street to easily attract customers. Jolly’s dream is to educate her children and set up a modern studio despite challenges of inadequate capital. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1958. She has three children who have gotten married. She and her husband sells groceries in a market to earn a living. Hien also collects metal scraps to make more money. She makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 dong (VND) per month. 
	
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy beverages, canned food, biscuits, and candies for selling in her store. Her dream is to enlarge her grocery store.
	Other members which are part of Hien's Group include the following:
	 Xuyen has six children. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy chicken feed. 
	 Duyen has three children. She raises pigs and sews clothes to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to raise pigs for selling.
	 Tam has two children. She is a carpenter. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to learn more carpentry.
	 Tam has three children. She is a farmer who raises cattle. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy food for buffalo and cows.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned food, biscuits, and candies for selling in her store.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta is a 62 year old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is engaged in basket weaving. She earns three thousand PHP a month from basket weaving. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase wicker - (is a hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used, and palm. In the future, Calixta would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy palm and wicker

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida is a 32 year old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two children. In 2008, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own business. She produces a wide variety of homemade food which she sells to customers from her town and the neighboring villages. Her husband, who works in transporting vegetables all over the villages, represents the main income source of the family. Raghida offers support whenever needed. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to cover her children’s study fees. She states that the loan will allow them to achieve higher educational levels. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans in order to better support her children.

loans.use: to cover her children’s study fees

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a Lebanese single man. He is 26 years old. He is living with his one parent and four siblings who are all working. He seeks to manage his family’s life with the cooperation of his siblings. This is the reason why they are all working really hard to afford heavy life expenses. Four years ago, Bashir started his independent business. He has opened a cafe in his town where he sells popcorn, chocolate, soft drinks and of course coffee. He has his own and loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy their time. 

With his requested youth loan of Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l he will be able to purchase a new espresso machine for his café in addition to many other goods. This will increase the number of his customers and most probably his revenues. One of his greatest dreams is to collect money and make needed savings, especially if he might get married in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new espresso machine for his café in addition to many other goods.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the village of Kardenakhi of Kakheti region. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 19-year-old son. Lali works as a music teacher at the local village and gets a monthly salary. Besides her main job, she is involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, she produces Churchkhela (Traditional Georgian sausage-shaped candies, produced with grape must, flour and threaded nuts onto a string) and sells them at the local open market. In addition, Lali’s husband has a tractor and serves to local farmers to get a service fee for the job. 

Nowadays, the tires of the tractor are damaged and he is forced to stop the operations. Lali has requested a loan to purchase new tires for the tractor. After the tires are purchased, her husband will continue working and this will significantly increase the family income. With the increased income, Lali will improve the living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for the tractor

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old, married and has six children. She is a farmer and also owns a retail shop. She has been farming for the last ten years and she is very active. She learned how to save through the help of Faulu Kenya.

She wishes to be financially stable and also own a big retail shop. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy ten bags of maize and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mayra  tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en compañía de su esposo y 2 de sus hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de pimienta, Departamento de Cortés.
Mayra se ha dedicado a realizar oficios domésticos en su hogar. 
Hace 8 años que decidió contribuir  con su familia económicamente, estableciendo un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica, tal es el caso que actualmente ella cuenta con un mini mercado donde ofrece a sus clientes: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, variedad de pan, carnes, lácteos, abarrotería, golosinas y cosméticos.
Con el propósito de captar una mayor cantidad de clientes, ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad 28,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de medicinas para enfermedades comunes, carnes,  lácteos,  embutidos, productos de limpieza, útiles escolares, refrescos y cosméticos.
Ella tiene la meta de fortalecer su negocio, ya que con las utilidades piensa preparar académicamente a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Mayra is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in an urban community of the Pimienta municipality in the department of Cortés.

Mayra takes care of the domestic chores in her home. Eight years ago she decided to help her family financially and started a business selling basic needs products. This is how she now has a minimart where she offers her customers rice, sugar, a variety of breads, meat, dairy products, groceries, sweets, and cosmetics. 

With the goal of gaining more customers, she has requested a loan for 28,000 Lempiras. She thinks she will use it to purchase medicines for common illnesses, meats, dairy products, sausages, cleaning products, school supplies, beverages, and cosmetics. Her goal is to strengthen her business because she wants to use the profits to prepare her children academically.

loans.use: to supply her business with medicines for common illnesses, meat, dairy products, sausages, cleaning products, school supplies, drinks, and cosmetics.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He is a maize farmer for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

He is servicing a second loan of KES. 25,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to purchase farm implements. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha sells food. She is 26, married, and has two young children. She has had her food stall for two years and works every day of the week in her business. Her stall's location is an advantage.

She is requesting a loan with which she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks and other products like wheat flour, rice, and sugar for preparing her food.

This purchase will allow her to make a greater income and expand her inventory. Her dreams and aspirations are: to strengthen her business and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase of soft drinks and other products like wheat flour, rice,  and sugar

loans.name: Viet's Group

texts.en:
Viet was born in 1986. He has a child who is 14 months old. His wife is a worker. Viet drives a taxi to earn a living. He makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month from it. His family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 dong (VND) per month. 
	
He has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the first cycle he would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy his own taxi. His dream is to provide a good living for his family.
	
Other members which are part of Viet's group include the following: 
	  
Khanh is 36 years old. She has two children. She sells vegetables to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy vegetables for selling. 
	 
Ca is 55 years old. She has two children. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy gas stove to cook fish.
	 
Van Anh is 26 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes for a living. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 dong (VND) to buy more clothes for selling.
	 
Thao is 24 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy food for chicken.

loans.use: to buy his own taxi.

loans.name: Banora

texts.en: Banora is a fifty one year old widow living in Kasese,Uganda. She has been farming for over twenty years and in order to get more money she has set up a stall in the market where she sells her output directly to consumers. Like most farmers she has the challenges of unpredictable weather which can lead to low yields and lack of appropriate preservation. She hopes to buy land, build a house and expand her business to new areas. Banora did not get enough output this season due to a prolonged drought and is unable to adequately supply her loyal consumers and thus has to buy from other farmers so as not to lose her customers. Banora is requesting a loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes, maize and other vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and maize (corn) to sell.

loans.name: M'thuranira

texts.en:
M'thuranira is aged seventy three. He is a  farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife. He has six children who have all cleared school. He has been in farming for over thirty years producing potatoes, milk and cereals that he sells to the people around his locality.

He is requesting for 30,000 KES loan from juhudi kilimo for purchasing poultry. From selling them he will earn extra income that will help improve his livelihood. He plans to have an incubator in the next five years that will help him have higher scale production .

High costs of feed and pesticides are his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1976. She has two children, who are learning at secondary school. Her husband and she make and sell traditional Vietnamese popcorn in a market to earn a living. Dung makes 3,000,000 dong (VND) a month from this. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 dong (VND) per month.
 
Dung has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy corn to explode popcorn. Her dreams are to open a popcorn workshop, and that her children grow up well.

Other members who are part of Dung's Group include the following:

Hien was born in 1971. She has two children. She is a vegetable supplier. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy and sell vegetables. 

Hong was born in 1967. She has five children. She sells fresh fruits to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy fruits from a wholesale market to resell.

Hien was born in 1990. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to raise pigs to earn more money.

Bay was born in 1969. She has two children. She is a fresh fruit supplier. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy fruits from a wholesale market, which she will resell.

loans.use: to buy corn to explode traditional Vietnamese popcorn.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a married lady, 28 years old. She and her husband have four children aged 13, 10, 7 and 5 years. She keeps livestock in their farm and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning an income of 12,000 monthly.

She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of 50,000 KES. She repaid the previous loan successfully.  She intends to use this new loan amount to purchase additional livestock to keep in the farm.  

She will use her profits to satisfy the needs of her family. She wishes to live a bright future with her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old, married woman, mother of two children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and sells charcoal to earn a living. She has challenges, including high rent, poor storage facilities, and price fluctuations. Notwithstanding these challenges, she has dreams to build a permanent house, to expand business to new areas, and to buy land for farming. Christine is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to resell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, who is now 54 years old, used his previous loan to buy seedlings and animal feed. His business did well and he has managed to repay his previous loan. He has grown tremendously and has saved his money through Faulu Kenya. 

He dreams of having a herd of six dairy cows and becoming an established farmer. He needs a loan of 42,727.50 KES to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). She has a retail shop selling cosmetics and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 1500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of weaves, braids, cream relaxers and Vaseline. She sells to all categories of people, but at retail prices. She works seven days out of every week and works in a shop which she rents. 

Her major business challenges include electricity, defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics In Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more Vseline, cream relaxer, braids, and boxes of weaves.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira, 35 years old, is married and has four children, all of them in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past five years, she has been selling coconuts at retail from her home. Thanks to her experience, she currently has a lot of customers, which permits her to have good sales. She also knows where to go to get good coconuts at low prices in order to sell them later.

Subira is looking for a loan in order to buy more coconuts and thus face the season with a good inventory. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich was born in 1965. She has two children who are employed, one as a worker and the other as a car repairer.  Bich and her husband collect metal scraps to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy and collect more metal scraps to recycle. She always wants to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy and collect more metal scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for looking after her 3 children. She operates a phone accessory shop and the business has enabled her to meet her basic needs and those of her family.

Due to the current campaign for digital migration and evolving technology, the business is lucrative.  There are challenges of theft and high license fees levied by the local authorities.  Annet has personal goals of educating her children up to the university level and expanding her business to new areas. Annet is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yannina Fernanda

texts.es:
Yannina es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una joven muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Yannina se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yannina trabaja como asistente en una empresa auditora de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yannina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para realizar sus trabaos académicos y laborales, así pues Yannina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Yannina is a 19 years old, single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic young woman who has a huge desire to succeed thanks to the efforts and support of her family. Yannina is currently studying to become an accountant. 

In her spare time she likes to distract herself by watching TV and sometimes she will cook a delicious lomo salteado [traditional Peruvian meat dish] to enjoy with her family. 

With a lot of effort and determination, Yannina works as an assistant at an auditing firm in her city. She starts her work day early every morning. She works approximately ten hours a day. She believes it is going well due to good performance and she is treated well by everyone. 

Yannina is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will be able to buy a laptop, which will help her with her studies as well as her job. This way she can keep working and striving to achieve her dream to be a successful professional and run her own business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy vive en casa propia sola; sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, tiene un puesto de ventas en la zona Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, ella se dedica a la venta de calzados para niños, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de calzados).

Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago se sus cuotas. Fue parte de Kiva en tres oportunidades.

Su sueño fue tener un puesto fijo y lo logró, ahora quiere expandir sus ventas a diferentes departamentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy lives alone in her own house. Her children are grown and independent. She has a vending stall in the District of Gran Poder in the city of La Paz. Nancy sells children’s shoes and her business enables her to support herself and pay for all of her necessities. This loan will be used as investment capital for buying shoes.

This is the 12th time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her as a good client since she has a done well with her payments. She has had three opportunities to participate with Kiva.

Her dream is to have an established vending post and was able to achieve it. Now she wants to expand her sales to various departments.

loans.use: to buy more children's shoes.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bolormaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Han-Uul district, Mongolia. Her husband, Munhbaatar, works as an electrician in a private company. Her daughter, Bilguun, is a college student. Mrs Bolormaa has been working at a food retail business on a rental stall since 2010.  She is planning to open her own food retail business and purchase her own stall instead of renting it. She is a hardworking and diligent person. She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventories to sell at retail price.

loans.use: To purchase inventories to sell at retail price

loans.name: Felicita Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Felicita, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad y una hija vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.
 
Doña Felicita es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella enseña su revista para que sus clientes escojan lo que necesitan, deja a crédito y cobra en dos o  tres cuotas de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas, lleva en este negocio ya 5 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de belleza. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben tanto ella como sus compañeras. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique y llegar a ser directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Quiroga meets every fifteen days in the Quiroga parish of the town Calceta, where the people largely dedicate themselves to agriculture, raising animale, and selling their products.

This is where Felicita, who is fifty-seven years old, married, and has three older children and a little daughter live in their home. Her husband is retired.

Felicita is a housewife who dedicates herself to sales in order to obtain her own income. She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works four days a week and sells door-to-door. She shows her catalog so her clients can pick out what they need. She leaves a loan and covers two or three of the fees as her clients prefer. What she sells most are the perfumes and creams. She already has managed her business for five years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other beauty products. She is a founding partner of the Communal Bank and also its president. She likes it because it it provides so much help for her friends and herself.

Her dream is to have a boutique and become the director of Yanbal.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Saviour

texts.en: Saviour is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children aged 2, 4 and 5 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling produce like maize, beans and millet. He is also a civil servant and earns a monthly salary. With the money he earns, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land. Price fluctuation and the seasonal nature of the product are his major challenges. Like all good fathers, he dreams of seeing his children graduate from university and have a sustainable income generating activity such as housing estates. Saviour intends to use the loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Airport. She is 26 years old and single with a 5-year-old child who is in school. Ruth stopped her education at 9th grade. For the past eight years, she has been selling rubber dishes in her community. Ruth says she spends most of her time with her business since her business helps to sustain them. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups) for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups) for her business.

loans.name: Bintu B.

texts.en:
Bintu B. is 34 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children between the ages of 14 and 26, who live at home and are currently in school.

For the past six years she has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. She started this business by selling on a table in front of her house with 1,000 LRD that she received from her fiancee. Her profits are used on food and school fees. She is happy with her business because the business helps her and her family. Most interestingly, she was able to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans and trousers) for her business. She plans to expand her business, help her children, and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fashion clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family.

He has a grocery store in his home which he runs himself. His store sells baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.

Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life and can support their household and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing inventory in order to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 23 years old, single and lives in Airport with two children aged 4 and 9 who are in school. She has been selling body cream, powder and soap for the past five years now, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder and soap for her business. She enjoys her business because it makes her independent. In the near future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder and soap for her business.

loans.name: Flerida Aracely

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Flerida, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 12 y de 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Flerida realiza el crédito tanto para su negocio como para el negocio de su esposo, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende helados Pingüino, colas, jugos y ciertos bocadillos de picar, mientras que  su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y porcino, ella tiene más de 13 años con su negocio y con los créditos  ha podido mejorarlo conforme ha ido pasando el tiempo, en la actualidad ha comprado varias mesas y sillas donde sus clientes llegan a servirse y esto gracias a los créditos que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más helados, sodas y ganado para el negocio del esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 11 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro de la ciudad de Calceta.
texts.en:
The parish of Quiroga, in the city of Calceta, is a place where many people work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.  The Quiroga Communal Bank meets here every fifteen days.
 
This is where Mrs. Flerida lives.  She is 33 years old and married.  She and her spouse have three children, aged 13, 12 and 2.  The oldest two are in school.  Her spouse is a merchant.
 
Mrs. Flerida is requesting the loan both for her business and for her spouse's business.  She has a business in her house, from which she sells Pingüino ice cream, colas, juice and snacks.  Her spouse buys and sells cattle and pigs.  Mrs. Flerida has had her business for more than 13 years, and with the loans, she has been able to improve it over time.  Now, thanks to the loans she received from the bank, she has bought various tables and chairs where her customers come to be served.
 
This loan will be used to pay for more ice cream, sodas and livestock for her spouse’s business.  Mrs. Flerida has been in the communal bank for more than 11 years, and she likes it because she has been able to improve her business with the loans.
 
Her dream is to have a business in the center of Calceta.

loans.use: To pay for ice cream, sodas and livestock.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame lives with her husband and two children. She runs a fish selling business, a business that she has been running for the last four years. The business is open to the public from 2pm until 8pm. Her advantage is the good location she has. She’s requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish for sell.  Dzame's goal is to improve her family’s living condition, to prosper with the business and to be able to overcome any problem that arises at home

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and 40 years old. She has two children.

She started a food stall business four years ago. She has had a regular flow of customers to sustain her business.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, oils, etc. Salama hopes that her business will expand to support the needs of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, oils, etc

loans.name: Jacklen

texts.en:
Jacklen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Jacklen is a 54-year-old woman. She is a housewife and a mother to one son. Her husband earns a pension which is low and not enough to cover the family's need.
Jacklen wants to offer better house living conditions to her family, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a refrigerator which the family will use for preserving food at their house. Taking this loan will create healthy and suitable living conditions for Jacklen and her family. 


About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: Buy refrigerator for home use

loans.name: Hospecia

texts.en: Hospecia is a 50 year old, married woman from Antequera,Bohol. She has five children. She is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets. She has been in the basket weaving for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more materials for weaving, like wicker (hard, woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used), and nito (palm). In the future, Hospecia would like to augment to other business ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 54, lives with her life companion and their children. She has a small store where she sells basic necessities such as grain, flour, eggs, bread, soap, and other items. Fatuma has been in business for several years and has gained valuable experience that has been useful in obtaining more income. She sells from her home and already has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she offers quality products, affordable prices, and excellent service. Fatuma is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has many goals that she wants to accomplish.

Currently, she wants to increase her inventory but she does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, flour, beverages, soap, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Inaem

texts.en:
Inaem is from northern Israel. After high school, she received her bookkeeping certification and has worked for many years as a part-time bookkeeper’s assistant. While she does her job well and is respected, the salary is minimum and comes nowhere to meeting her family’s income needs. Now that her children are grown and beginning their own families, Inaem was determined to create a microenterprise and ensure a secure economic future.
