She wanted to make sure she and her husband not only get by every month but can live with dignity and help their children. Inaem studied cosmetology and took certification courses. Earlier this year she opened a cosmetics salon in her home. The salon has a separate entrance, which allows her to keep costs low, since the business is located in her home, but ensure privacy with the separate entrance. She has gained a strong reputation for professional treatments with high quality products at competitive prices.

Inaem needed this loan to purchase a high frequency cosmetic device, an epilator, steamer, treatment bed, and a cosmetics and material cart.

Inaem continues to work as a bookkeeper's assistant. She applies her professionalism and knowledge to develop her microenterprise. One day Inaem wants to open a complete cosmetics salon.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sr. De Qoyllority Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sr. de Qoyllorty” en la comunidad de Muñapata del distrito de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. (La comunidad de Muñapata se encuentra ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios por ejemplo; crianza de animales menores, venta de leña, venta de comestibles, venta de miel, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida. 

(La señora Flora está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 
Flora vive en la comunidad de Muñapata donde realiza diferentes tipos de actividades. Una de sus actividades económica principales es la crianza de animales menores y la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Flora requiere el préstamo para mercadería como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz por lo parte tambien comprara animales menores como cuyes. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Sr. De Qoyllority” which is located in the community of Muñapata in the District of Urcos, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco. The community of Muñapata is located 35 minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members have worked together as a Communal Bank for several years and are well-organized. They view each moment as an opportunity to move forward, so they strive each day to provide a better future for their children. The members participate in business activities such as raising small animals, selling firewood, selling food products, selling honey, selling cosmetics, and selling meals.

In the photograph, Sra. Flora is the woman with her hand raised. She lives in the community of Muñapata and engages in different business activities. Among her main business activities are raising small animals and selling basic necessities. She has been in business for several years and has done very well. Flora is taking this opportunity to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar. She will also buy small animals, such as guinea pigs.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been given to them and promise to complete their respective payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, as well as guinea pigs to raise.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha  48, is a mother of five children, married and living at West Point. Her children are between the ages of 19 and 31. Three of her children are independent, while the other two stay with her at home, and are attending school. Martha has a table in her community where she has sold rice, pepper, onions, vita, palm oil, cooking oil, and tomatoes for the past eight years. She makes a profit when she sells because she is the only one that has a food market in the community. She is proud of her business because with the profits she can buy more goods, and pay the educational expenses of her children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, vita, and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nanzugu

texts.en:
Nanzugu sells fish. She lives with her family, that is made up of her husband and five children. She learned her business from her aunt before she was married and she works everyday of the week. One of her advantages is that she already has a customer base. A risk that she encounters is climate change.

She needs a loan to buy fresh product: fish, as well as cooking oil for frying her fish before she sells it from her home. Nanzugu hopes to improve her family life by providing stability, and in the future to open a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 64 years old, married and has four children. She is a farmer who sells poultry and farm produce of mangoes and oranges. She has been farming for the last twelve years. She is very hardworking, and since she became a client of Faulu Kenya she has improved her living standards.
She hopes to be a main supplier of fruits in the surrounding towns and institutions through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. She needs 100,000 KES to buy chicks, chick mash, and pesticides for the mango and oranges trees.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chick mash, and pesticides for the mango and orange trees.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter.

Elena lives in Biet Lahia district near to Jabalia Refugee Camp. Elena and her husband are planning to have their own project: to purchase a taxi to transport passengers from one area to another. Elena and her husband have an amount of money which is not enough to cover all the costs. So she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her, and her husband, complete the purchase of the taxi that her husband will drive. This will offer Elena's husband a stable project and create a profitable income source, which will improve the family's income positively.

Elena is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of a the taxi.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gaby como de cariño le dicen es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable paltica que ha pasado por varias situaciones dificiles Gaby tiene 33 años de edad es una mujer separada, con su actual pareja formo una familia con dos niños. Gaby tiene un club de productos herbalife, lleva teimpo ya en la actividad y la inicio porque fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de un club estonces le parecio muy buena idea y fue como empezo a incorporase a un club tomando charlas, capacitaciones etc. Hace unos meses que finalmente intalo su local en San Felipe del Progreso, esta vez esta solicitando un credito a la institucion para comprar de Té, Aloes y malteadas para su venta, platica que le gusta mucho su atender a sus clientes y mas que nada que ayudarlos porque para eso se fundo Herbalife para ayudar a las personas.platicaq ue no tiene ninguna dificulatad para la venta de sus productos aunque le gustaria tener mas clientes llegar a 100 para poder tener una vida mas comoda para ella y para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gaby, as she is affectionately known, says that she is a hardworking and responsible woman who has gone through many difficult situations. She is 33 years old and separated from her spouse. Gaby and her current partner have their own family with two children. She formed an Herbalife club and spends time in this business. Gaby started her business after a friend invited her to join a club and at that point she thought that it would be a good idea. She formed her own club after attending seminars, training sessions, and other events. A few months ago, she finally opened her shop in San Felipe del Progresso.

Gaby is now requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad so that she can buy teas, aloe vera, and shake mixes to sell. She says that she greatly enjoys serving her customers, but most of all, she wants to help them since Herbalife was founded on the premise of helping people. Gaby says that she has not had any difficulty with selling her products. She would like to reach more customers so that she can get to the 100-mark, since this would allow her and her children to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Herbalife products.

location.town: El Tunal San Felipe del Progreso.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Airport, is 22 years old, and single. She has an eight year old child, who is in school and at home. For the past five years, she has been selling body cream, powder, spry, and soap in the local market. She is thankful to God for the financial output for her child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and soap for her business. Her plans are to educate her child and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 46 year old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has six children.The eldest child is twenty, while the youngest is four. She is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets made of buri (palm). She earns four thousand pesos a month by doing the basket weaving. She has been in the basket weaving business for twelve years.

Flora requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchased materials like buri (palm), and wicker (hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used). In the future, Flora would like to invest in other ventures to improve their status of living, and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy buri and wicker.

loans.name: Julio Apolonio

texts.es:
Don Julio, es de la comarca la Cruz, Teustepe casado tuvo 5 hijos con su esposa, los que ya están casados .Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde que tenía 15 años. Lo que cultiva  lo vende en mazorca para hacer güirilas (tortilla hecha de maíz dulce) o elotes cosidos dice que así se vende a mejor precio. Las tierras donde cultiva le fueron dadas por el gobierno para realizar las labores de siembra lo hace con ayuda de un mozo y la cosecha la vende en la misma comarca.  
Hoy  Julio necesita este crédito para comprar el abono  y pagar el arado del terreno para sembrar el maíz. El crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá sembrar el maíz y comprar todos los insumos y el abono para obtener buen rendimiento.  También dice que este año que viene quiere diversificar la producción con la siembra de chile.
texts.en:
Don Julio is from the region of La Cruz, Teustepe. He and his wife have five children, all of whom are married.

Julio has been growing corn and beans for 15 years. What he produces is sold in Mazorca for making “güirilas” (tortillas made from sweet corn) or roasted corn on the cob. He says that is able to sell for the best price. The land that he cultivates was given to him by the government for the planting he accomplishes with the help of an assistant and for the harvested crops that he sells in the same region.

Today Julio needs a loan so that he can buy compost and pay to have his land plowed for planting corn. This loan will be a great help since he will be able to plant corn and buy all the supplies and compost needed to obtain a good result. He says that he also wants to diversify his production this year by planting chile peppers.

loans.use: to buy compost and to pay to have his land plowed.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Yeredon  ont  en moyenne 44 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Abi  (1ere personne debout avec foulard bleu clair) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 200 kg d’oignons frais 3 sacs de sel 5 paquets de maggi    auprès des demi gros a Kimparana. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Abi espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women who compose the Yeredon group are all married in extended traditional families. On average, they are 44 years old and have seven children each. They all live in a village called Niazekan, located in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, marriage and kinship.  They buy and sell condiments.

In order to boost their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Abi, first from the left and wearing a light blue scarf, is planning to use her loan to buy 200 kg of fresh onions, three bags of salt and five boxes of maggi bouillon cubes from semi-wholesalers in Kimparana. 

She sells for cash, from her home, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

Abi is expecting average monthly profits from this loan to reach 12,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to meet the needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Desde que tenía 10 años Pascual se ha dedicado a la producción de café y fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para que pudiera llevar a cabo esta actividad. Pascual es soltero y viven con él 3 sobrinos quienes le ayudan a realizar los trabajos necesarios en su finca de café. a Pascual le gustaría cambiar su producción de café convencional a café orgánico con la ayuda de los asesores de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”. Para la siguiente cosecha él necesita un crédito para poder pagar a los trabajadores que contratará. Entre los planes que Pascual tiene están el de resembrar parte de su terreno pues las plantas con que cuenta ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productivo. También tiene otro terreno sin sembrar y le gustaría utilizarlo también para producir café y así aumentar su producción. Además del café Pascual también produce maíz y limón. Pasando la cosecha a Pascual le gustaría hacer una presa en su terreno para las épocas de sequía.
texts.en:
Since the age of 10, Pascual has engaged in coffee production. It was his father who taught him everything he needed to know so that he could carry out this activity. Pascual is single and lives with three nephews who help him with the necessary tasks around his coffee farm. He was able to switch from growing conventional coffee to organic coffee with the help of the consultants from Unión Regional de Huatusco.

For the following month, Pascual needs a loan so that he can pay the workers he plans to hire. He intends to replant a portion of his land since the existing crops have completed their productive life cycle. He also has another plot of land that is untouched, so he would like to make use of it for growing coffee so that he can increase his production.

In addition to coffee, Pascual grows corn and lemons. When he is not working the land, Pascual would like create a stock pond on his property for periods of drought.

loans.use: to hire workers for planting coffee.

loans.name: Estrellas De Sajama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE SAJAMA”  iniciará el trigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Cascada, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de centro, venta de libros, venta de masitas y empanadas, venta de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de café, venta de cereales, tejido de macramé, venta de abarrotes, venta de rellenos, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de preparación y comercialización de masitas; cuenta que este negocio lo inicio cobn la venta de galletas hace años, posteriormente aprendió a realizar algunas masitas mismas que fueron éxito en su negocio y para especializarse en esta área fue a un instituto a diversificar su comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de herramienta (compra de batidora) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo implementará en su negocio para la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo sin garantía y consultorio.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Sajama" Communal Bank will begin its thirty-second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Regional Office. It is made up of twelve members led by a board of directors with Ana serving as president. The communal bank's members support themselves with a variety of businesses, including sewing petticoats, book sales, sale of "masitas" [small savory pastries in a variety of flavors] and "empanadas" [savory stuffed pastries], candy sales, juice sales, coffee sales, grain sales, macramé-making, grocery sales, sale of "rellenos" [stuffed mashed potato fritters], and a sewing workshop.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Ana. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, having been invited by a relative who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business preparing and selling masitas. She says that she started this business years ago by selling cookies. Later, she learned to make some masitas, which were a hit in her business. To specialize in that area, she took classes to diversify her sales.

The loan that she will now take out is for the purchase of equipment—like a mixer—that she will buy from wholesale sellers and then set up in her business for the preparation of her products. Her work allows her to generate income to support herself and her family economically, since she is a single mother of one son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the collateral-free loans and the advice.

loans.use: to buy an electric mixer.

loans.name: Chicas Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS INOLVIDABLES”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de quinua, venta de ropa, producción de papa, venta de verduras y frutas, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de quinua; cuenta que este negocio lo ejerce hace años, emprendiendo el mismo con una asociación comunitaria que comercializa dicho producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará al exterior. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Chicas Inolvidables" (Unforgettable Girls) will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro-Woman) as part of a central focus in Patacamaya. It is composed of nine workers and is directed by a board of directors where Juana is president. The businesses that move the the communal association workers forward are diverse, including the sale of quinoa, the sale of clothing, potato production, sale of fruits and vegetables, and sale of cattle.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Juana is a worker. She notes that it is her fourth cycle as a part of Pro Mujer. She was invited by the invitation of a promoter who works at the institution and came to visit her in her house. She now has a business for producing and selling quinoa. She has practiced this business for years, undertaking the same business with a community association that commercializes said product.

The loan that she will take out is to raise capital for the sale of seeds, which she will acquire from the fairs in the town of El Alto and later will harvest to sell outside. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her home in all ways possible because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Yereta N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les  femmes du groupe Yereta N°1 ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Rokia  (1 ère femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paquets de maggi 2 boites de concentrée de  tomate,  3 sacs de sel de cuisine et une grande quantité d’épices. Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de Kimparana et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly in traditional extended families, the women of the Yereta N°1 group are on average 37 years old and have 7 children. They all live in the village of Niazekan in the area of Segou (4th administration region of Mali) and know each other through neighborhood ties, professional activities, and kinship. They practice in the buying and selling of all kinds of condiments. 

With the goal of satisfying the needs of their customers who are more and more numerous and demanding, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their first group loan.

Rokia (the first woman standing on the right) excels in the selling of condiments. She is highly sought after in the business. She expects to use her loan to buy 10 packets of Maggi, 2 boxes of tomato puree, 3 bags of kitchen salt, and a large amount of spices. She procures her goods at the Kimparana market and makes her sales in cash, retailing to a mixed group of customers. 

With this loan, Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to help her husband take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Marie Paule

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 32 commerçante. Elle fait fait l'élévage des poulets et porcs qu'elle revend une depuis 1 an déjà  elle fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, elle  est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, pour le vende avant de racheter de nouveaux poussins et porceletd d'où la rupture de stock quotienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins et porcelets) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 32-year-old woman who raises chickens and pigs to resell. She has been doing this for one year already and it is going well. However, she does not have much capital, so she is obligated each time to wait for the stock she buys to be raised and sold before she can buy new piglets and chicks. This causes interruptions in her stock which causes her customers dissatisfaction quite often.

She is asking for this loan to buy a large quantity [of piglets and chicks], which will allow her not only to satisfy her already growing customer base, but also to earn more profits. 

The profits from this loan will help her to increase her business (by increasing the number of her chicks and piglets) and also to support the everyday needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks

loans.name: Bibien

texts.fr: Bibien est une femme de 43 ans séparée, mère de 4 enfants.Elle gère un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 10 ans déjà où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et de la nourriture.Elle a acquise au fil du temps une expérience dans le domaine ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable. Malheureusement,la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement la demande de sa clientèle ce qui crée par conséquent une diminution importante de celle-ci ce qui entraîne de ce fait la baisse de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons . ce qui lui permettra de retenir et gagner la clientèle mais plus précisément d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. benefice qui lui permettra d'une part d'agrandir et d’aménager sa structure et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Bibien is a 43-year old woman who is separated and mother to four children. She has been managing a bar in one of the capital's districts for the past ten years and she sells healthy drinks and food there. Over time she has acquired experience in this field and this has enabled her to build up a significant customer base. Unfortunately her limited stock does not allow her sufficiently to meet customer demand; this has led to a significant decrease in customer demand and in turn to a decrease in her sales and profits. She is thus requesting this loan so that she can buy more crates of drinks. This will enable her to retain and increase her customer base, and more significantly to increase her sales and profits, which in turn will enable her to expand and refurbish her bar and also provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Last Stop Group

texts.en:
Last Stop is made up of four traders who sell different items, including foodstuffs, vegetables, detergents and material. 

Samuel, the leader of the group, sells material. He is standing second from the left in the photograph. Samuel lives with his wife and two children who are aged 14 and eight and who are both studying. His dream for his family is to give them the best so that they have a good profession in the future. 

He has been selling material for 8 years now in a kiosk on the road side. His work schedule is from the morning to evening. The business is located in a strategic area which attracts many potential customers. He buys the material and supplies it to customers in the township. He needs the loan in order to buy more material to be able meet the demand and the competition in the local market.

One of his goals is to continue with the business in order to generate more income to guarantee him quality of life.  

The group needs a total amount of GHC 2,400 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more material to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lugwe

texts.en:
Lugwe is 49 years old and has six children. He is married to Mgumba, who works as a farmer.

To support their family, Lugwe started a goat-meat business at home with just two goats. He sells at the market, mostly to the people who buy for slaughter in the slaughterhouses. He has gained a respectable number of customers through friends and relatives in the past four years.

He requires a loan to increase the number of goats to meet the growing demand. In the future, he wants to further expand his business, which will enable him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from Gurjaani district of East Georgia. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband, two children (two and 12 years old), parents-in-law and a brother-in-law. Irma’s father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Her husband works as a singer and gets a monthly salary. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they sow onions on the family-owned land. In addition, Irma purchases nuts and produces Churchkhela (traditional Georgian sausage-shaped candies, produced with grape must, flour and nuts threaded onto a string) which is sold in the capital city. Irma is very hard-working young woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to cultivate the plot of land and purchase onion seeds. The loan will help her to provide financially for her needs. She will sow onions on her agricultural land and with proper seasonal work she will be able to get a good harvest to sell at a good price. This will increase her income and Irma will renovate her house to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land and purchase onion seeds.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Maysa is a 43-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and her husband is employed. However, he gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs.

Maysa needs to change her old bedroom furniture, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will enable Maysa and her husband to enjoy healthy and comfortable sleep and improve their living conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For twenty years he has been trading in produce, mainly maize and beans. He started by growing his own crops, then sold then and got capital to buy in bulk from other farmers. 

His challenges include price fluctuation and inflation which erodes most of the profits. His dreams are to build a permanent house for residence as they are currently living in a mud-wattled house and setting up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Frank is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Frank Yamundu Group

texts.en:
Kevina is a 48-year-old hardworking woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for ten years and also practices farming. She faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation, which negatively impacts her projected profits. Kevina's personal goal is to build a house for residence, while her business goal is to have a wholesale shop.

Kevina is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in accessing credit. That is why there are many members in addition to those who requested the loan. 

Kevina intends to use the loan money to buy salt, soap, sugar, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, sugar, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 61-year-old hardworking lady with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been running a confectionery business since 1995, which she started with the aim of earning a living and paying school fees for her children. 

Florence is serving a number of customers including schools, supermarkets, and the general markets with a variety of eats. She is facing a challenge of unreliable workers and high labor turn over. Besides that, she is aiming at expanding her business to new areas. 

Florence intends to use the loan to buy a pressing and sealing machine used in packaging.

loans.use: to buy a pressing and sealing machine used in packaging.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Desde hace 10 años, Maria en condiciones de mujer viuda y madre de 4 hijos adultos, sale desde muy temprano al mercado a comprar ranchos, víveres y productos de la canasta familiar,  para vender en su tienda, ubicada en la linda e historica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, a los clientes de su propio barrio y de zonas aledañas a él. Sus compras las realiza de contado y en pequeños volumenes  y por ello debe ir al mercado varias veces a la semana. Los compradores de Maria, son principalmete sus propias vecinas, amas de casa, que adquieren los articulos de la canasta familiar, en pequeñas cantidades para comsumirlos diariamente. Este negocio fué idea de su esposo, ya fallecido, y con el ha logrado continuar generando ingresos para el bienestar de su hogar; al principio solo vendia  productos fritos en pocas cantidades, pero viendo la necesidad de la gente, fue agregandole, víveres poco a poco y luego refrescos, bebidas y hoy  tambien vende mercancia variada, principalmente cosméticos y articulos de perfumería. En la actualidad necesita aprovechar la fiestas de fin de año, época en la cual sus ventas se incrmentan y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, para responder a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará arroz por bultos, aceite en pimipnas, productos de belleza y cervezas, que son los que en general tienen un mayor consumo, entre sus clientes en este fin de año, lleno de festividades familiares, donde en los hogares comparten comidas, alimentos y bebidas, para celebral la navidad y la noche buena
texts.en: For 10 years, Maria, the widowed mother of 4 adult children, has gone to the market very early to buy food, groceries and basic family basket products to sell in her store. It is located in the historical city of Cartagena de Indias. The customers are from her own neighborhood and from the nearby areas. She pays for her purchasing up front and in small volumes and that's why she has to go to the market several times a week. Maria's customers are mainly her own neighbors, housewives who acquire the basic family basket items in small quantities to consume daily. This business was her late husband's idea. With it, she has been able to continue generating income for her household's wellbeing. At first she only sold small quantities of fried food, but when she saw what people needed she expanded adding groceries little by little and later snacks, beverages and now she also sells varied merchandise, mainly cosmetics and cosmetics. Right now, she needs to take advantage of the end of year holidays when her sales increase and her working capital is insufficient for responding to the customers. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy sacks of rice, containers of oil, beauty products and beer. These are generally the most popular products with her customers towards the end of the year with family parties and shared meals, food and drinks to celebrate Christmas and Christmas Eve.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 1 container of oil, snacks, crates of beverages, and beauty products.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Ms Kosar is a 47-year-old married woman. Eight years ago, she started her own business of a general store. When her husband got severely ill, she did not lose hope and initiated her business to answer the needs of her family members. With the passage of time she has retained many customers and now enjoys dealing with a good number of customers every day.

She is a mother of three children, one of whom is school-going. She dreams to provide a good and quality education to her other children as well. She needs to cover everyday expenditures and educational expenses. For this, she is required to improve her business and has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR in order to buy stocks of grains, sugar and flour. She needs to keep her business fully stocked so as to satisfy the demand from her customers, increase sales, and improve her earnings. 

She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to cover the expenses of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 50 years old. She has six children and is widowed. She lives with her family in a neighbourhood in the town of Samburu. 

For three years, she has been making a living selling household items from her small grocery store, where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, bread, over-the-counter medicines, sugar, and other items. The grocery store is located at her house and she already has a good clientele. The main challenge is that she sells few products and therefore earns little income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu.

The loan she is requesting is for 40,000 KES and she will use it to supply her business with staple food products to be able to improve her income in order to help her family. Her plan is to grow her business and, thus, have a variety to offer her customers and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, sugar, rice, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 37 years old, married to Alice and supports a family of six members. He operates a butchery and a cafe and has been running the business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is requesting a second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the profits to enlarge his business. 

His dream is to put more effort into his business and to diversify into large scale farming to better his living standard.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for his cafe.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a hardworking married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. For ten years she has been running a retail shop. She started the business after a fruitful maize harvest that she sold to nearby schools. 

Inadequate capital is affecting the business, but her dreams are to expand her business into a wholesale one and to educate her five children. Margret is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for class materials and to do home improvement.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is married, with five children, three of whom go to school. She has a retail shop selling sugar, soap, salt, bread and beans. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap, beer and soda. 

She has been doing this for 10 years, selling on a retail basis only. She generates additional income through rental houses. Her major business challenges include the transportation of commodities from Kikuubo in Kampala to her shop, thieves and defaulters. 

She hopes to own a fully stocked wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes electricity, water and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap, beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman of 50 and a mother of four children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in business for 32 years. She gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase a dairy cow. In future she wants to be a successful dairy farmer in her village.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 38-year-old married man and a father of four daughters. He lives with his family in a small village. For three years he has owned a small grocery store, which has been profitable and the only source of income for his family. It is the only grocery store where he lives, and it has many loyal customers. Despite this, the store needs support from time to time to cover its costs.

Hamzeh is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, dairy products and canned food. This will increase sales and increase Hamzeh's income, so he will be able to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy needed groceries for his store.

loans.name: Elí De La Cruz

texts.es:
El Sauce está ubicado a 90 km al occidente de León, es un pueblo con una población bastante grande que se caracteriza por tener actividades meramente ganaderas y comerciales donde abunda la leche, cuajada, crema, queso y producen lo que es el maíz y frijoles.

En el habita desde que nació don Elí de la Cruz, un señor de 69 años que se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar arduamente para darles el pan de cada día a su familia, es originario de una comarca de dicho municipio donde se dedicaba a la agricultura y trabajó muchos años en la corte de caña.

Con el paso de los años y para tener una mejor calidad de vida se trasladó a vivir al Sauce donde instaló dos molinos para brindar este servicio a los pobladores en un barrio donde no contaban con este beneficio. Este molino lo que hace es triturar el maíz para elaborar las tortillas que es el principal alimento del plato Nicaragüense. 
Cuenta con la ayuda de dos nietos quienes habitan con él y viendo la posibilidad de crecer en su negocio tiene la meta de comprar otro motor de molino para instalarlo en otro barrio potencial el cual será atendido por uno de sus nietos por lo cual necesita la ayuda de kiva a través de Ceprodel para que le otorguen un crédito de $ 695.00 para pagarlo en 12 meses con la ganancia del mismo Molino.
texts.en:
El Sauce is located 90 kilometers west of León and i a town with a pretty large population known for livestock and sales of milk, curd, cream and cheese and also for producing corn and beans. 

Elí de la Cruz lives here, a 69 year old man that has spent his whole live working hard to put food on the table each day for his family. He is from a region of the municipality that is focused in agriculture and he worked for many years cutting sugar cane. 

With the pass of time and to reach a better quality life he moved to El Sauce where he installed two mills to bring this service to the people of a neighborhood who do not have this benefit. The mills pulverize corn to make tortillas which are a staple of Nicaraguan meals. 

He has two grandchildren who live with him and is looking into the possibility of growing his business. He has a goal to buy another mill motor to install in another potential neighborhood which will be attended to buy one of his grandchildren. For this reason he needs Kiva's help through Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan of $695.00 which will be paid over 12 months with the earnings of his mills.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his mill.

loans.name: Derickson

texts.en:
Derickson, 31, lives alone in a rental house in the town of Samburu. He is a single visionary man. He’s been managing his carpentry shop for five years. He learned how to manage the shop with his father, who taught him to make wood furniture. He currently works in it full-time.

He’s requesting loans to buy several types of wood, such as olive, cedar and pine, to increase inventory and have on hand things he needs. This will help him to do his work with no setbacks.

His hope is to expand the shop into a large salesroom.

loans.use: to buy wood like olive, cedar and pine.

loans.name: Flor De Cempazúchitl Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Cempazuchilt esta es una comunidad donde la mayor parte de los habitantes hablan la lengua mazahua los habitantes de la comunidad, son seis integrantes del grupo los cuales todos tienen una actividad como Artemio y Martha invertiran en borregos, Teresa invertira en Cerdos, Jacinto en vasos de licuadora y Abel en pollos. estos mismos integrantes son los que eligieron el monbre del grupo y lo eligieron porque en la casa del representante donde se reunen, sembro flores de cempazuchitl, esta flor se utiliza para adornar las ofrendas que se ponen el dia de muertos o en los panteones.
Don Alfredo quien tambien forma parte del grupo es un hombre de 39 años de edad sin duda un hombre muy responsable, siempre sonriendo ante cada situacionque está casado con la señora María del Carmen con la cual tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales actualmente sólo 3 de ellos dependen aún de él. Don Alfredo solicita este crédito ya que él se dedica al comercio de plásticos, en específico a la venta de vasos para licuadora en el cual tiene 6 años de experiencia, cada 8 o 15 días que necesita mercancía él va a una comunidad muy cerca de su pueblo llamada San Agustín Mextepec donde se surte de lo necesario, él va casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos y en ocasiones los vende en el tianguis, él decidió emprender este negocio ya que el trabajaba en la ciudad de México y se terminó el trabajo y quedó desempleado y él necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia, “El único problema casi siempre es la falta de dinero” comenta don Alfredo, dice que también se dedica a la siembra en hortaliza y lo que más siembra es silantro, rabano, coliflor, brocolí, el señor Alfredo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que necesita un impulso económico, un préstamo de KIVA sin duda lo ayudo mucho ya que gracias al anterior prestamo pudo poner una pequeña tiendita donde vende lo necesario esta muy contento por este logroa ya que es una manera de mejorar la caliadad de vida de sus hijos y de su esposa quien aun dependen de El.
texts.en: The Flor de Cempazuchitl [Yellow Marigold] group is a village, the majority of whose inhabitants speak the Mazahua language.  The group is made up of six members, all of whom have a business:  Artemio and Martha invest in sheep, Teresa in pigs, Jacinto in blender goblets and Abel in chickens.  It was these same members who chose the name of the group, because the representative in whose house they meet grew cempazuchitl flowers, which are used to decorate offerings on the Day of the Dead or are placed on tombs.  One of the group's members, Alfredo, is a 39-year-old man who is obviously very responsible and always cheerful, whatever the circumstances.  He is married to María del Carmen, with whom he has had 7 children, only 3 of whom are currently still dependent on him.  Alfredo is applying for this loan as he is in the plastics trade; in fact, he has six years' experience of selling blender goblets.  Every 8 or 15 days, when he needs stock, he goes to a nearby village called San Agustín Mextepec when he stocks up with what he needs.  He goes from door to door trying to sell his goods and, occasionally, sells them at the street market.  He decided to set up his business as a means of supporting his family after his job in Mexico City finished and he was left unemployed.  "The only problem is almost always lack of money" says Alfredo, who says that he also grows vegetables, mainly coriander, radishes, cauliflowers and broccoli.  Alfredo is a very hardworking and responsible person who needs a financial boost.  A loan from Kiva would undoubtedly help him tremendously as his previous loan enabled him to set up a small shop where he sells essentials.  He is very happy with his achievement since it is a way of improving the quality of life of his children and wife who still depend on him.

loans.use: To buy blender goblets and to stock his small shop which sells bread, cold drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 49, is from Olkalou and is married with five children who are all in school.

Peter has a butchery business that he has been operating for the past 13 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a cow to slaughter to add to the inventory in his butchery.

He hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a man of 30. He is married to Ann and a father of two children. He is a carpenter in Kiambu and has been doing carpentry for ten years now. His  monthly income is 50,000 KES.

This will be Gerald's second loan with KADET LTD. He paid the other loan successfully and without difficulty. He wants to be a successful businessman in Kiambu.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 48 years old and divorced. She lives with her three daughters in the town of Samburu, Kenya. 

Ten years ago, Rose set up her own business at home, where she makes men's, children's and women’s clothing such as dresses for all occasions, skirts, blouses, coats, uniforms, etc. She has always worked in this business, as it was something she learned at a very young age and is now her source of income.

With the loan of 20,000 KES she has requested, Rose plans to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. She will use these to make clothing and therefore provide better customer service. Rose’s goal is to have a larger business and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela vive en casa de sus padres en un departamento que le dieron en anticrético, tiene un hijo, trabaja con su movilidad, el nivel de educación es secundario, ocupa un cuarto en acabado de ladrillo, la casa está ubicada en la zona San Martín de la Ciudad de la Paz. Gisela ya no vive con su esposo, pues se separaron.

Gisela, trabaja con su micro bus prestando servicio de transporte automotor de carga por carretera, con el cual genera sus ingresos, para el pago de alimentación, luz, agua y otros servicios básicos de ella y su hijo en el anticrético donde vive.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de repuestos de su movilidad (compra de un par de llantas, líquidos de frenos y transmisión, nuevo filtro de aire), el sueño de Gisela es mejorar sus ingresos para su comodidad de vida y en un futuro tener casa propia.

Es la décima segunda vez con IMPRO  y la octava con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecha con el crédito.
texts.en: Gisela lives in her parents’ house in an apartment that was given to her in anticrético. She has a son. She works with her vehicle, and she has a high school education. She occupies a brick room, and the house is in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz. Gisela no longer lives with her husband because they are separated. Gisela works with her micro-bus providing land cargo transportation. This generates her income to pay for food, electricity, water, and other basic services for herself and her son in the anticrético where she lives. She needs the loan to buy replacement parts for her vehicle (to buy a pair of tires, brake and transmission fluids, and new air filter). Gisela’s dream is to improve her income to make her more comfortable and to have a house in the future. This is the 12th time with IMPRO and the eighth time with Kiva that she has had loans. She is very happy about the loan.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for the vehicle she uses to transport cargo.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell.

He is a 36-year-old married man with three children. The family is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For four years he has been operating a retail shop, and with the income earned he has been able to provide for the family. He has the challenge of limited funds to meet consumer demands. His dream is to become a wholesale trader. 

Robert is requesting this loan to buy bread, sugar, and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 31 years old and single. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been farming for six years. He also sells shoes to generate more income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Michael has been able to boost his business. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He needs a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Livingi

texts.en:
Livingi is a 38-year-old man with six children who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been trading in a local brewery business. With the income earned, he has been able to pay the school fees for his children and buy land.

His business challenges are a lack of inadequate capital to facilitate the business and customers not paying on time. 

Livingi would like to educate his children up to the university level and expand his business to the city where there is a ready market. He intends to use the loan to buy local brews to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brews to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, 32 years old, married to James and a mother of three children, has been selling new clothes in Kiambu for three years now. She earns a monthly income of about 10,000 shillings.

This will be Jennifer’s first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy new clothes for resale. In future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for monthly tuition fees and to buy materials.

loans.name: Kamugenyi Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 42-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He works six days a week on his farm and grows tea, maize and beans. He has been farming for 14 years. He also earns a side income from his retail shop, which he started in order to meet his daily expenses since farming is seasonal.

His major challenge is a lack of modern farming equipment to farm extensively. His dreams are to buy a tractor and use modern farming methods.

Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides and to pay workers. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides and to pay workers.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 37 years old and married to Esther. He is a father of three children.

William sells shoes in Kiambu. He has been in this business for five years now. He earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be William’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more shoes for resale. 

In the future, he wants to diversify his business and open a supermarket so he can become a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kaija

texts.en:
A 45-year-old father of four children living in Kagadi, Uganda, Kaija has been operating a retail shop selling food for three years now. His major challenges are customers not paying on time and price fluctuations.

Having used his previous loan to purchase more food items to sell, Kaija is requesting a loan to purchase maize and beans to sell. He would like to diversify his business to include a supermarket, and dreams of educating his children and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single young man. This photo was taken inside his barber shop.

For the past three years Mohammad has had a barber shop, which is the only shop of this kind in the place where he is. He has a good reputation among customers, which has been profitable for his business. He has a lot of loyal customers, but the shop needs some support to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new barber kit, which has tools such as different types of hair scissors, a collection of hair brushes, and hair and face creams. This will improve his work and satisfy the desires of his customers, which will lead to increased demand from his customers and an increase in income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new barber kit.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas has been running a retail shop - a business he ventured into four years ago - and now earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Silas has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase two bales each of baking and maize flour, boxes of biscuits, cooking fat, washing detergents, and tissue paper. 

The anticipated profit from this business will help him purchase more stock. He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase two bales each of baking and maize flour, boxes of biscuits, cooking fat, washing detergents, and tissue paper.

loans.name: Levekato

texts.en:
Levekato is a married woman with 5 children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Fifteen years ago she decided to trade in clothes in order to support her growing family. She started as a market vendor and, after accumulating enough capital, she rented a house and set up a boutique. Her love for fashion also prompted her to start the business. She mainly sells men shirts. 

Inadequate capital to meet the different tastes and preferences of her customers is her major challenge. Her dream is to own a fashion school. 

Levekato is requesting a loan to buy clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to re-sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lady of 43 years, married to George, and a mother of five children. She does dairy farming in Kiambu and has been doing so for fifteen years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Jane's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her children. 

In future she wants to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred, age 33, lives in West Point. She is a single parent with three children between the ages of 1 and 9. Only two of her children are in school. 

For the past seven years she has been selling ladies' and children's slippers in the open square of the market. One difficulty she faces is low sales during the rainy season. She makes a profit because of the fashion slippers that she sells. 

Winifred is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers for her business.

loans.name: Consulate

texts.en:
Consulate, a 26-year-old mother of two children, has been operating a salon business for five months now, having begun it with savings accrued from her teaching job. Inadequate capital and high transport costs are factors affecting her business growth.

Having used her previous loan to buy cosmetics for her salon, Consulate is requesting a new loan for the same purpose. She wishes to expand her business into other new markets and buy land for growing crops. Consulate also has a dream of building a permanent home and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is 24 years old, married and has two children, who attend school. She works very hard to provide for her family.  For the past two years, Maggie has been selling different types of local fruits and vegetables near the market. She currently has a lot of customers, which permits her to have good sales. She also knows where to purchase  good fruits and vegetables at low prices.

Maggie is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fruit and vegetables and face the season with a good inventory. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, kale,and cabbages.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар  мужчина в возрасте  50 лет.   Он женат , и имеет единственного сына.  К сожалению он не смог дать сыну образования и в данное время его сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках.  Сын Анвара каждый месяц по возможности присылает своим родителям денежные средства.   Жена Анвара  дома занимается  шитьем   национальных подушек и курпачей (матрас) .  Сам он по специальности стоматолог,дома имеет стоматологическое оборудование и   принимает клиентов у себя дома.  Но все что  он  зарабатывает все  уходит на проживание семьи.  Так как сейчас осень и начинается дождливый сезон  Анвар хочет отремонтировать крышу своего дома так как крыша уже два года протекает.  На полученный кредит хочет купить строительные материалы и побыстрее отремонтировать крышу до зимы. Анвар  заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за поддержку.
texts.en: Anvar is 50 years old, married, and has one son. Unfortunately, he was unable to afford to pay for an education for his son, so his son currently works in the Russian Federation and tries to send money to his parents whenever possible. Anvar's wife works from home sewing traditional national pillows and mattresses. Anvar is a stomatologist and treats his clients at home where he has all the necessary equipment. However, all his earnings go towards supporting his family. Now that the rainy weather of autumn has arrived, Anvar wants to repair the roof of his house because it has been leaking for the past 2 years. He will use the loan money to buy construction materials to fix his roof before winter. Anvar thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to  purchase building materials

loans.name: Munyasya

texts.en:
Munyasya is 51 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he farms and sells vegetables, mainly kale. He has been in the business for six years. He also does livestock farming for more income generation.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. This is because he has been trained in business management skills. He needs a loan of 10,935 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet used the previous loan to buy office supplies to sell. She is a hardworking woman aged 31 who is married with four children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She runs a stationary business, which she has operated for nine years. She got capital from her husband to start the business. She wishes to educate her children up to the university level. Her business is affected by price fluctuations, and her dream is to trade in wholesale. 

Harriet intends to use the loan to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина молодая женщина в возрасте 25 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих  детей.  Занимается она у себя дома откормом скота так как не имеет образования.Она  в наличии  имеет 5 голов мелко рогатого скота.  Этому виду  деятельности ее научили родители.  Ее муж работает на стройке, помощником мастера. И в свободное время старается помогать своей жене.  Мадина старается развивать свой бизнес по животноводству так как  основной доход от этого. На полученный кредит Мадина хочет приобрести скот  и тем самым увеличить поголовье скота.  Она очень благодарна Арванду, что с помощью таких организаций люди с низким и средним уровням жизни могут осуществить свои планы и улучшить свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Madina is a young woman of 25. She is married and has 2 children. She raises cattle at home because she does not have an education, and her parents taught her animal husbandry. She began with 5 head of livestock. Her husband works in construction as an assistant foreman, and in his free time, he helps his wife. Madina is now trying to develop her business, as this is the main source of income for the family. She will use the loan money to buy more livestock to increase her herd. She is very grateful to Arvand for assisting low- and middle-income people to realize their plans and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy  cattle

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба  женщина в возрасте 40 лет.    Замужем, имеет 3 детей.    Она   вместе с мужем   более  12 лет занимается  откормом скота.   В наличии имеет около 7 голов мелко рогатого скота. Махбуба содержит скот у себя дома и она  очень хорошо разбирается в преимуществах своего дела, знает когда закупать и продавать скот.  Также у них  есть сад  где её муж выращивает фрукты и овощи.   Весной  и  летом  её муж продаёт фрукты на базаре от своего урожая.  Старший сын Махбубы находится в РТ на  заработках и каждый  месяц по возможности отправляет денежные средства свои родителям. А младшие ее дети  пока  учатся в школе.  Махбуба  на полученный кредит планирует купить скот  и откормив до весны продать за хорошую цену. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For over 12 years, Mahbuba and her husband have been keeping livestock, and presently have around 7 sheep and goats. Mahbuba keeps the animals at her home. She is an expert in the intricacies of her business and knows well when to purchase and when to sell livestock. In addition, the family has a garden where they grow fruit and vegetables. In spring and summer, Mahbuba's husband sells their harvest at the market. Their eldest son is presently working in Russia and, if possible, sends money to his parents every month. The younger children currently attend school.

Mahbuba plans to use this loan to purchase livestock and, having fattened it during the winter, to sell it at a good price in the spring. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used the previous loan to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell. He is a 27-year-old married man who has been running a produce store for 13 years, having got start-up capital from farming. Inadequate capital is affecting the business.  

He would like to expand his business to other areas within the district and educate his three children. 

Stephen intends to use the new loan to purchase groundnuts to sell since the demand is very high.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts  to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.ru: Диана очень добродушная, вежливая, предприимчивая, трудолюбивая. Торговая точка Дианы расположена на центральном рынке. Она торгует женской и мужской одеждой, носками, колготами и штанами. Благодаря удачному расположению торгового места Дианы и хорошей покупательской способности, ее бизнес идет успешно. Кредит понадобился для закупки зимних вещей: теплых носков, колгот, кофт и штанов.
texts.en: Diana is very kind, polite, enterprising and hard-working. She has a sales outlet at the central market where she sells both menswear and womenswear, including socks, tights, and pants. Thanks to the good location of her outlet and the purchasing power of her clients, her business is successful. Diana is seeking a loan to buy winter clothing: warm socks, tights, and pants.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing: warm socks, tights, sweaters and pants

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Djekafo  ont  en moyenne 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la quartier Lafiabougou se San dans la région de Ségou  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente d’habits de poissons et font de la restauration. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 12eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents.
Madame,   Kadia  (1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la restauration. Elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier de Lafiabougou et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé, 10 bidons d’huile de 5 litres et du bois de chauffe.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadia  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
de 52000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djekafo group, the majority of whom live in large traditional families, average 48 years of age with six children each. They all live in the Lafiabougou se San district of Ségou and met through neighbors, their professional activities and relatives. They buy and sell clothes and fish, as well as carrying out restauration activites. 

With a view to satisfying their ever-growing and increasingly demanding customer base, the members of this group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their 12th group loan, having repaid the previous loans in full.

Kadia, (who is standing on the far right of the photo) excels in the restauration business. She is in great demand in the district of Lafiabougou and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy ten sacks of wheat flour, ten five-liter containers of oil and firewood. She sells for cash and on a retail basis to a diverse customer base. 

With this loan, Kadia is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 52,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband in providing for the various household needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont  en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de DALLAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d'habillements, de tasses plastiques et de diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  4 eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts  précédents.
Madame,   TENIN  présidente de l’association (2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche photo) excelle dans la vente de cosmétiques et de bijoux. Elle est très sollicitée à DALLAN  et ses environs. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux douzaines de parfum 5 douzaines de crème pour la peau surtout en cette période de froid  et une grande quantité de bijoux à Bamako.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame TENIN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 16500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Danaya group, the majority of whom are married and living in large traditional families, average 46 years of age with three children each. They all live in the village of Dallan in the region of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neigbhbors, their professional activities and relatives. They buy and sell cosmetics, clothing, plastic cups and various other goods.

With a view to satisfying their ever-increasing and more demanding customers, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fourth group loan, having repaid in full the previous loans. 

Tenin, who is the president of the association (standing second from the right in the photo) excels in the sale of cosmetics and jewelry. She is in great demand in Dallan and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy two dozen perfumes, five dozen body creams (particularly for this cold period) and a large quantity of jewelry in Bamako. She sells for cash, on a retail basis and on credit to a diverse customer base. 

With this loan, Tenin is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 16,500FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her activity and to help her husband in providing for the household's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 60 years old, married and has four children.  

To earn a living, he raises and sells goats. He has been in the business for 12 years. Previously, he used to sell charcoal.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and improved his living standards. David has requested a loan of 21, 363.75 KES to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 53 years old, married and has four children. 

He does livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money. He has also used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

He has requested for a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь использовала предыдущий кредит для постройки новой теплицы, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Несмотря на трудности, присущие бизнесу Любви - падение цен на томаты, болезни, плохие погодные условия - она настроена оптимистически и считает, что усердный труд - ключ к решению любых проблем.
На этот раз Любовь просит предоставить  ей кредит для ремонта и переоборудования своих четырех теплиц. Она хочет подготовить их к началу сезона и успеть до посадки помидор.
texts.en: Lubov used her previous loan to build a new greenhouse which allowed her to increase her income. Despite all the difficulties inherent in Lubov's business - falling prices for tomatoes, diseases, bad weather conditions - she is an optimist and believes that hard work is the key to solving any kind of problem. This time, Lubov is seeking a loan to fix and renovate her four greenhouses. She wants to prepare them for the start of the season, before it is time to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to repair and renovate greenhouses

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.

He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for 10 years. 

In order to supplement his meager salary he decided to venture into produce buying and selling. The business has been very lucrative. 

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet demand are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a food store in town.

Edward is requesting a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce needs to invest more in her vegetable business, which is why she’s requesting a new loan to buy water pipes. She wants to be doing some irrigation on her vegetables during the dry season to continue producing fruits and vegetables. The previous loan allowed her to improve and increase her inventory and profits to support her family and provide their food and their schooling.

loans.use: to buy water pipes.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua continues selling medicines. She says that the business is doing well. Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved. 

However, she needs to make further home improvements. She wants to have piped water in her house. She is asking for a loan to buy water pipes and cover installation costs. 

Her aspiration is to have a prosperous business, improving her family's financial situation, since this will allow her to offer her relatives better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and cover installation costs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a dedicated woman who has the urge to move forward. She is happy for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. 

With this new investment, she wants to expand her business by buying more chemicals and seedlings with which she is sure to produce more farm produce.

Caroline hopes to continue providing a better life to her family. The previous loan had a great positive impact on her.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Fernanado Rafael

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Fernanado compró pescado y lo vendió así mismo con ello completó el dinero con el cual compró un congelador. Hoy su negocio está mucho mas elegante y maneja con cuidado la cadena de enfriamiento.
