En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento con el que comprará en mayor volumen pescado, aprovechando el alto consumo de bocachicos, vagres, lebranche,  en el fin de año, lo cual proyecta un aumento en sus ventas. Así mismo comprará 2 nuevas lavadoras, para ampliar su servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar, con ello sus vecinos se sentirán mejor atendidos y el ganará un poco mas. Fernando dice a sus finaciadores: "gracias por el apoyo que me han brindado para seguir adlante con mi negocio; espero que puedan seguir ayudando a todos los microempresarios en sus prouectos."
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Fernando bought and sold fish, with which he got together the money to buy a freezer.  Now his business is much more elegant and he carefully operates the cooling chain.

Currently he's asking for another loan to buy fish wholesale, making the most of the high consumption of bocachico, catfish, and mullet at the end of the year, which projects an increase in his sales.  He also will buy two new washing machines to expand his washing-machine rental service so his neighbors will feel better served and he will earn a bit more.

Fernando says to his lenders: "Thank you for the support you have given me to get ahead with my business.  I hope you can continue helping all the microentrepreneurs with their projects."

loans.use: to buy fish and two new washing machines

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en:
Rimah is a young mother from Haifa. After finishing high school she began volunteering to gain experience. She has been working in customer service and has been able to gain a strong understanding of how to work with clients. 

She took manicure and pedicure training and has opened a home-based nail salon. Rimah continues to work part time to ensure steady income but she invests her time to expand her home-based salon. Her client base is growing and Rimah is determined to build a stronger economic future for herself.

Rimah needed this loan to help pay for renovations, painting the room, installation of a dividing wall, manicure and pedicure stations, table and client chairs.

Rimah wants to continue to grow her business wisely and one day open a salon in Haifa’s center.

loans.use: To help pay for renovations, painting the room, a dividing wall, manicure and pedicure stations, table and client chairs.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Paynesville South. For the past two years she has been selling men's jeans and trousers in the market. 

Abigail is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more men's jeans and trousers.  With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods and helps with the expenses of the home. Her plan for the future is to buy land and build house.

loans.use: to purchase men's jeans and trousers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul used his previous loan to buy a bull for slaughter in his butcher shop. He earned more income, which he used to boost his farming business.  

He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He needs a loan of 74,013.75 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine wants to stock her vegetable stall and to make improvements to it. She is requesting a new loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to continue offering a variety to her customers. She believes this investment will afford her a lot of work for a period of time.

With her previous loan, Christine made improvements to her business. At the current level of sales, she has been able to provide well for her family and buy some items for the home. She hopes to continue making improvements through these means.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Antequera, Bohol. Rosalie raises hogs, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her husband is a carpenter.

Rosalie is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds for the pigs and materials for the construction of a pig pen such as cement and wood. In the future, she would like to invest in other business ventures to support her family as well as save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and materials such as cement and wood.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe djiguiya ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier  de Santoro de la ville de San dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  diverses marchandises. 
 les membres du groupe sont des habitués de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  4eme   prêt solidaire.
Madame, ASSA  (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite) excelle dans la vente de tissus wax. Elle est très sollicitée dans la ville de  SAN et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 rouleaux de pagnes auprès des grossistes de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame assa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All four of the women in the Djiguiya group are married and live in large, traditional families. The mean are for the group is 41 years old, and each of the women has, on average, four children. They all live in the Santoro neighborhood of the city of San in the Ségou region (4th largest administrative region in Mali). The four women met each other through neighbors and family. They sell various goods.

The group members have worked with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, on several occasions. They are now on their fourth group loan.

ASSA (2nd from the left in the photo) excels in the sale of waxed fabrics. She is in high demand in the city of San and its surroundings.

She plans to use the loan to buy 2 rolls of pagnes from wholesalers in San. She sells her goods retail for cash to a clientele made up of both men and women.

With the loan, Assa hopes to earn a mean monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and help her spouse support their family.

loans.use: to buy panges

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, tienda de refrescos, tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de trenzado de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar en un taller de tejido, posteriormente decidió emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a las tiendas a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The  “PERLAS”  ["pearls"] Community Bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana central office. The group is made up of ten members and is governed by a Board of Directors, the president of which is Eva. The members' businesses are varied and include: blanket plaiting, a drink store, blanket weaving, a grocery store, and cheese sales.

This loan will benefit these businesspeople. Eva says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter from the institution. She has a sewing business and plaits blankets. She tells us that she learned this work from working in a weaving workshop and later decided to open her own workshop.

This loan is for an increase of working capital (the purchase of wool). She will buy the wool from the wholesalers. She sells her finished products to stores who make orders. This work allows her to generate an income to support her household where possible. She is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Jean Hamilton

texts.es:
Jean es un joven de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa junto a sus padres a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. Jean es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo estudio la carrera de ingeniería ambiental, pero actualmente se encuentra trabajando como empleado en el municipio de su ciudad, el realizar los trabajos de archivos de documentos y labora alrededor de 10 horas al día, asimismo también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y ofrece su mercadería a los compañeros de trabajo; él cree que le va bien porque es amable y sobre todo respetuoso.

Jean esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar ropa como pantalones, polos, short, entre otros y de esta manera tener mayor variedad de productos, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jean is a young 22-year-old who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his parents whom he supports with his income. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. He worked very hard as a student, studying environmental engineering. However, at the moment he is working as a municipal employee in his city of residence. He archives documents and does other work for about ten hours a day. He also has a small clothing business. He sells clothing to his coworkers. He believes that this business is going well for him because he is kind and, above all, respectful.
Jean is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support they have provided he will be able to buy clothing such as pants, polos, shorts, and other items. This way, he will have a greater variety of products and be able to improve his income. He will be able to keep working toward his greatest dream: "To have my own home".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (pants, polos, shorts, and other items).

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is presently residing happy and peaceful with his family. He is 46 and blessed with three children. Jimmy is involved in a farming business which is planting rice in their field. Through the business, Jimmy is able to send his children to school, though it is not the only source of income for the family. With his determination to improve their living and quickly respond to his family's necessities, Jimmy plants vegetables for additional income generation. He believes that education is his only treasure to give to his children. That’s why he is doing his best to further support them and finish their college education.  

Jimmy continues planting rice. He is already preparing his rice field to plant. Jimmy needs additional capital to buy farm inputs. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. He hopes that applying a complete amount of farm inputs will lead him to a better yield and income as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Hae

texts.en: Hae is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately 2 USD daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs the taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about 4 USD each day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about 6 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Hae is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase will help her obtain more land to grow rice and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 2 years, earning approximately 3 USD daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about 3 USD each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Moeurn is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase a rice grinding machine for rental. This purchase will help her generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a rice grinding machine for rental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Jose compró ropa para damas caballeros y niños, con su anterior credikiva con el cual quedó muy satisfecho, porque aumentó sus ventas, pues tenia muy surtido su negocio. En la actualidad se propone aprovechar el último bimestre del año, para hacer su mejor venta, pues en esta época usualmente se incrementan sus pedidos, generadores de  utilidades   y esto a él lo entusiasma. Esta es la razón por la cual con su nuevo credikiva comprará ropa en todas las líneas y para todos los gustos, pues desea que las familias que lo visitan,  se vistan en las festividades de fin de año, con la mejor ropa que solo se vende en su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es realizar mejoramientos locativos a su vivienda y por eso dice a sus financiadores: Gracias por el apoyo, porque a  través de este crédito han crecido los ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en: Jose was very satisfied with his previous loan because increasing his stock resulted in increased his sales. He used his loan to buy clothing for men, women, and children. He currently wants to make the most of the last two months of the year and make his best sales yet. This is the season where his orders normally increase-and his income as well. This is exciting for Jose. He will use this new loan to buy clothing of all brands and for all tastes. He wants the families who visit his store to be able to get outfits for the end of year festivities. He only sells the best at his store. His goal for the future is to make improvements to his store. For this reason, he says to his lenders: Thank you for the support, because through these loans my household income has increased.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all brands for all tastes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional bridal gowns and dresses needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juliet hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional bridal gowns and other merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Andrilita

texts.en:
This is Andrilita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Andrilita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories needed in her business

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 53 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are employed.  She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Ran sells papaya salad and Khmer noodles, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Her children earn about $6 per day. 

Ran is requesting a loan for $1,500, which she will use to purchase a tricycle to transport sugarcane juice, meat balls, and papaya salad to sell. This purchase will help her earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle to use for carrying sugarcane juice, meatballs, and papaya salad.

loans.name: Serigne Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Moustapha est un jeune étudiant célibataire qui vit au Sénégal et pratique parallèlement  à ses études le commerce de prêts a porter depuis 3 ans. Il n’a aucune charge mais veut développer son activité de commerce afin d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en prêts a porter destinés à la vente.
texts.en: Serigne Moustapha is a young single student who lives in Senegal. Along with his studies, he has been running his business selling ready-to-wear clothing for the past three years. It would take Serigne Moustapha little additional work to expand his business once he has an increase in his working capital. He is a member in one of the branches of UIMCEC, where he has already successfully repaid his two prior loans. Serigne Moustapha is currently requesting a loan of 100,000 XOF, with which he plans to purchase a supply of ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE CORAZON”  iniciará el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, servicio de comida, salón de peinados, taller de imprenta, venta de calzados, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de comida que es un negocio familiar y ella lo sigue trabajando desde hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y carne) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DE CORAZON”  Communal Bank is about to start its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes office. There are eight members and the group is governed by a board of directors. Señora Lidia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: carpentry, food services, a hair salon, a printing workshop, shoe sales, and juice sales.
This loan will help these small businesses. Lidia tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for nine months. She joined at the invitation of some friends who were already members. She runs a food business. It is a family business and she has been working there for years.
She will use this loan for an increase in working capital (the purchase of vegetables and meat). She will acquire these products from the wholesale stores. After making her food, she will sell it. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is married and has one child.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou habite au Sénégal et évolue depuis 17 ans dans le secteur de la menuiserie. Il est marié et prend en charge les paiements des factures de meme que les charges de la dépense quotidienne. Il commence tous les jours ses activités a partir de 8 h le matin jusqu'à 18 h le soir. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa localité d’habitation et a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 prévu pour la réparation de son véhicule. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité, accroitre ses revenus et en fin parvenir a améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son vœu futur est d’être propriétaire d’une industrie de menuiserie.
texts.en: Mamadou lives in Senegal and has spent the past 17 years working in the field of carpentry. He is married and is responsible for the payment of bills as well as the daily household expenses. He begins his daily activities starting at 8:00 am and works hard until 6:00 in the evening. Mamadou is a member of his local branch of UIMCEC, where he has already fully repaid his two previous loans. He is currently requesting a loan of 300,000 XOF, which he plans to use for the repair of his vehicle. Mamadou's goal is to further develop his business, increase his revenue, and ultimately improve the health and nutrition of his family. His wish is to someday be an owner in the industry of carpentry manufacturing.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Yorsely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yorsely de 35 años, tiene una sala de belleza y planea hacer inversiones a su negocio porque comprará tintes, shampoos, enjuagues y alisadores, que son los productos que ella usa más frecuentemente en su negocio. Yorsely tiene mucha experiencia en su trabajo, porque estudió en 2 academias de belleza, y después trabajó 3 años en una peluquería, aunque hace 12 años, trabajaba  a domicilio, generaba ingresos de esta manera y con ello  poco a poco fue adquiriendo los implementos necesarios, para su propia sala de belleza. Ahora, Yorsely ofrece cortes de cabello, blower, tintes, manicures, pedicure, y también vende productos de belleza, después de asesorar profesionalmente a sus clientes en lo que tiene que ver son su imagen personal y profesional . Sus clientes son vecinos del sector y amigos que le refieren cada vez más clientes.
En la actualidad Yorsely  está aplicando a un credikiva y espera lograr con él, un mejor surtido de productos como tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, alider de cabello y  productos capilares y cosmeticos para aumentar sus ventas para  generar más ingresos. Ella sueña con brindarle un ambiente confortable a su clientela y por ello le gustaría lograr una mejor presentación de su negocio, para  finalmente  comprar una casa propia para su familia, que la integran su esposo y los gemelos de 8 años de edad.
texts.en:
Yorsely is thirty-five years old.  She has a beauty salon and plans to make investments in her business.  She will buy hair dyes, shampoos, rinses, and hair straighteners/relaxers since these are the products that she uses most frequently in her business.

Yorsely has a lot of experience in her work because she studied at two beauty schools and later worked for three years at a hairdresser's shop.  Twelve years ago, she was making house calls, generating income in this same way.  Little by little, she acquired what was needed for her own beauty salon.  

Now, Yorsely offers haircuts, blow-drying, dyes, manicures, and pedicures, and she also sells beauty products.  She professionally advises her customers on their personal and professional image.  Her customers are neighbors in the community and friends that have been referred to her, increasing  her number of customers.

Currently, Yorsely is applying for a Kiva loan and hopes to gain a better assortment of products, like dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair straighteners/relaxers, and haircare products and cosmetics to increase her sales and to generate more income.  She dreams of offering a comfortable atmosphere to her customers.  She would like to advance the image of her business so that she can finally buy her own house for her family, where she would live with her husband and eight-year-old twins.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair straighteners/relaxers, and haircare products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es una joven de 19 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. Deysi vive al lado de sus adres a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo como obrera en un fundo de su ciudad, ella debido a sus pocos recursos económicos tuvo que dejar de estudiar la carrera de ingeniería forestal, ya que no le alcanzaba para los gastos de los mismos. Pero nos comenta que se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades.

Deysi está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres ya que colocara falso piso ya que actualmente es de tierra y ha tenido problemas de salud por ello, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño el cual es terminar su carrera y ser el orgullo para sus padres”.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 19 year old young woman who lives in the district of Santiago in Ica, Perú. She lives with her parents whom she supports with the fruit of her labor as a worker on an estate in her city.  Due to scarce financial resources, she had to stop studying to be a forestry engineer because she was unable to meet the expenses required. However she says that she works hard every day in order to get ahead despite the problems she faces.

Deysi is very grateful to Kiva lender because, thanks to their help, she will be able to improve her parents’ home: she will install a raised floor because now there is simply a dirt one and there have been health problems because of that. 

Deysi said that she will continue struggling to make her dream a reality, which is to finish her studies one day and make her parents proud of her.

loans.use: to install a raised floor in her parents' house.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft-drinks retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more soft drinks to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Jean's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALMERAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de canastas, venta de ropa de cholita, venta de utensilio de cocina, venta de verduras y papa, venta de recogedoras de basura, elaboración de papas fritas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina que es un negocio familiar desde hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de utensilio de cocina) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “PALMERAS”  Communal Bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes central office. There are eight members and the group is governed by a board of directors of whom Señora María Eugenia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: plastics sales, basket sales, traditional clothing sales, kitchen utensil sales, vegetable sales, dustpan sales, and making french fries.
This loan will benefit these businesspeople. María Eugenia tells is that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of some friends who were already members. She has a business selling kitchen utensils. This business has been in her family for years.
She will use this loan for an increase of working capital (the purchase of kitchen utensils). She will buy these products from the wholesale stores and later sell them from her storefront. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries for her variety store business.

NWTF is relisting Catalina's business profile  in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha is 32 years old, married and has four children. She resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker and her husband is a construction foreman, earning about $11 each day. Additionally, he is a fisherman who generates extra income for the family. Chantha is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase fishing equipment. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to use for fishing.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending and tricycle transportation businesses. Ma. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Ma. Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Cojña Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Willma es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos: trenzado de mantas, venta de mantas a pedido, venta de refrescos, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Willma es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de trenzado de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar en un taller de tejido, posteriormente decidió emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a las tiendas a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Chojña Pampita” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Wilma.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of activities among which are: blanket weaving, blanket sales to order, soft-drink sales and grocery store.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Wilma.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited to do so by one of the institution’s promoters who went to visit her at home.  She currently has a blanket weaving business.  She relates that she learned the business by working in a weaving workshop and eventually decided to start her own workshop.

The present loan will be to increase her capital.  She will buy fabric in wholesale stores and then sell what she makes to stores on order.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Bellas Rosas Jp Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLAS ROSAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Feliza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos: venta de chompas tejidas, tejido de mantas y chompas, venta de ganado, venta de enaguas y faldas, costura de deportivos, tienda de llantería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Feliza es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace años, ya que conocía la técnica desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Bellas Rosas” (Beautiful Roses) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board presided by Feliza.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of business among which are: knitted sweater sales, blanket and sweater knitting, cattle sales, traditional skirt and blouse sales, sportswear sewing and tire repair shop.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Feliza.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago having been invited by one of the institution’s promoters who went to visit her.  She currently has a business knitting blankets.  She started it years ago on her own initiative since she’s had these skills since she was a girl.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy yarn in wholesale stores and then sell what she makes in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home in the best way possible since she’s married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Flor De Pera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PERA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez y nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florentina es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de fruta, producción de verduras, venta de fruta, venta de verdura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florentina es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de frutas; cuenta que este negocio lo ejerce hace 35 años, iniciando con un pequeño terreno aprendiendo este de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Pera” (Pear Flower) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center.  This group consists of 19 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Florentina as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as producing fruit, producing vegetables, selling fruit, and selling vegetables.  

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Florentina, who is a member of the group.  She says that this is her second loan cycle since joining Pro Mujer.  Florentina says that she received an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her house.  At the moment, she has a business that involves producing and selling fruit.  She says that she has been in this line of work for 35 years and started out with a small plot of land.  Florentina learned her trade from her parents.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used as operating capital for purchasing seeds.  She will buy the seeds at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  After her harvest, she will sell her products at the fairs.  Working in this manner enables her to support her household.  Florentina is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Florentina says that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Las Vecinas De Humachua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VECINAS DE HUMACHUA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos: venta de abarrotes, costura, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio, artesana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de polleras y mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su padres hace años y decidió realizar su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Las Vecinas de Humachua” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board presided by Teodora.  The communal bank members have a variety of business among which are found: grocery sales, sewing, fruit sales, vegetables sales, beer sales, neighborhood store and crafts.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Teodora.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of Pro Mujer having been invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business sewing shirts and blankets.  She relates that she learned this business from her parents years ago and decided to set up her own workshop.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She’ll buy fabric in wholesale stores and sell what she makes in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home the best way possible since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health service.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Yanaptasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YANAPTASIÑANI”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carla es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de artículos de belleza, venta de vajillas, venta de embutidos, venta de fruta, comerciante de condimentos, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carla es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo al observar a su madre generar recursos mediante esta actividad posteriormente ella decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceites, concervas, etc.) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece nuestra institución.
texts.en:
“Yanaptasiñani” is a Communal Bank that will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. It is composed of eleven members, guided by a directive board presided over by Carla. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as running a neighborhood store, selling groceries, selling vegetables, selling beauty products, selling dishware, selling sausages, selling fruits, selling dressings and working as a driver.

Carla is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Carla says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, and that she has been invited to enter by some friends who are members of this institution. She currently runs a neighborhood store. She says she has learned this job by watching how her mother made a living from this activity, and she lately decided to start her own shop.

The loan she in now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying food products at wholesale prices to the sell them in her shop. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically provide for herself, as she is single.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic and the savings offered by our institution.

loans.use: to purchase oils and jams

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GARDENIAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de polleras y mantas, venta de plásticos, venta de api, comidera, venta de carne de cordero, venta de queso, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de nuestra institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde niña ya que no contaba con su madre y ella tenía que salir adelante.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zanahorias, cebollas, etc.) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo y el consultorio de la institución.
texts.en:
“Gardenias” is a Communal Bank that will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Silveria. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different retailing activities, selling various articles such as skirts and blankets, plastic items, “api” (non-alcoholic maize drink), lamb meat, cheese and furniture.

Silveria is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Silveria says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight years, and that she has been invited to enter by one of the promoters of this institution who came to visit her at her house. She currently engages in selling vegetables. She says that she has started this activity since she was a child, has she could not count on mother and she had to provide for herself.

The loan she in now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying vegetables that she will buy at wholesale prices to the sell them in the fairs of the town of El Alto. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically provide for her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and she has two children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the institution’s health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 30 years old, married and has two children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than five years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband is employed in a gas shop, earning about $5 each day. In order to improve her business, Mom is requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase more groceries to sell. This purchase will help her increase her stock and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn is 61 years old, married and has three children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling natural medicine for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is involved in cultivating rice and breeding pigs. He earns about $3 each day. All of her children are employed. They earn about $10 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Moeurn is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma is a 35-year-old hardworking and very trusted repeat Kiva client. She lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver in a private company, having worked for a public transportation company for nine years. Javzanpagma has a 6-year-old son who goes to kindergarten and a 15-year-old daughter in secondary school. 

Javzanpagma started her business in 2004 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, Mongolia's biggest raw materials outdoor market, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. In 2007, she bought a semiautomatic cutting machine for 3,000,000 MNT to produce firewood. Javzanpagma buys raw materials from the wood truck which comes from the countryside and sells the firewood. As a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 7,500,000 MNT.
 
Autumn is the wedding season in Mongolia, thus Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more wood and to prepare for her younger brother's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming season

loans.name: Savutha

texts.en:
Savutha is 41 years old, married,  and has four children.  She lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Savutha sells groceries, which she has been doing for more than seven years.  She earns about $27 a day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $20 a day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Savutha is requesting a loan for $1,500, which she will use to purchase a generator to run an additional business of arc welding. This purchase will help her generate additional income to support her family. In the future, Savutha would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for arc welding.

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr: Monsieur Diégane est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal. Il évolue dans le secteur des services et employé comme gardien dans un des guichets de l’UIMCEC de la zone périurbaine et ou il est membre et a déjà remboursé 6 crédits antérieurs. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans sa profession. Il a en charge ses 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 1 et 9 ans. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs. Une partie du financement sera consacré aux dépenses familiales pour son séjour a son village natal a l’occasion de la fête de tabaski et l’autre partie sera destiné à renforcer la quantité de briques qu’il est en train de rassembler dans l’objectif d’élever un bâtiment. Son intention est de rénover sa maison et il rêve aussi de devenir un chef dans une institution de gardiennage.
texts.en:
Mr. Diégane is a married man living in Sénégal. He works in the service sector, and he has been a security guard for a UIMCEC branch in the peri-urban area where he is a member and has already repaid six loans. He has over ten years of experience in this line of work. He has two dependent children aged 1 and 9.

He is seeking a loan of 200,000 F. Part of this credit will be used to finance a family visit to his native village for the Tabaski celebration, and the remainder will be used to increase a supply of bricks for an upcoming construction project. 

He plans to renovate his home, and in the long run, he would like to become the head of a security service.

loans.use: to finance family expenses and to make bricks for a construction project.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane vit au Sénégal dans une localité de la banlieue. Il s’active dans le domaine des services s et est peintre de profession. Il est marié et prend en charge les factures d’eau, mais il participe aussi a la dépense quotidienne. Il a une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Ses heures de travail journalières sont comprises entre 9h le matin et 22 h le soir. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa localité et a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de compresseur en vue de rendre plus performante son activité. Ainsi l’accroissement de ses revenu pourra l’aider a améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son souhait dans le futur est d’ouvrir une quincaillerie, devenir un grand transporteur et disposer d’un verger.
texts.en:
Ousmane lives in a suburban community of Senegal. He is active in the service sector and is a painter by profession. He is married and is responsible for the payment of the water bills, and he also helps to pay for the daily household expenditures. Ousmane has the experience of working for the past 20 years in his profession. His daily working hours are between 9:00 am and 10:00 in the evening.

Ousmane is a member of the local UIMCEC branch in his community, where he has already successfully repaid his two prior loans. He is currently seeking a loan of 150,000 XOF intended for the purchase of an air compressor, which will help make his painting business more efficient. The increased income he expects will allow him to improve the nutrition and health of his family. Ousmane hopes to someday open a hardware store, become a major supplier and have an orchard.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor for his painting business.

loans.name: Bebelacion

texts.en:
Bebelacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell in the market.

NWTF is re-listing Bebelacion's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell in the market.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El Señor  Carlos tiene 41 años de edad, convive con su esposa  en unión libre,  reside en compañía de sus 3 hijos y esposa  en  el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Bárbara.
Carlos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura produciendo granos básicos (maíz y fríjoles) y café. El posee una pequeño finca de café donde la producción que obtiene la comercializa en pergamino húmedo.
Con el propósito de brindar el mantenimiento adecuado a su finca ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra a jornales para la nutrición y limpieza respectivamente del cultivo de café.
En el futuro Carlos espera ahorrar sus utilidades para comprar un vehículo que le permita sacar sus cosechas de su finca.
texts.en: Carlos, 41, is in a common law relationship with his wife.  He lives with her and their three children in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara Department.  Carlos has always worked in agriculture growing basic grains (corn and beans) and coffee.  He has a small coffee farm and he sells what he grows in damp parchment stage.  Aiming at providing adequate crop care, he’s requesting a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay to hire day laborers to feed and weed the coffee crop.  Carlos wants to use profits in future to buy a vehicle he can use to transport his harvest from his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mendsuren

texts.en: Mendsuren is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children, who range in age from 11 to 16, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer districts of the city, and her children attend public school while her husband works as a sergeant at a local group of soldiers. Mendsuren supports her family by selling clothing at two retail stalls in the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She began her business in 2002, and it has grown so that today she has 2,100,000 Mongollian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Because she has successfully expanded her business, she has also been able to improve her family's living conditions. She bought a car for her husband in 2008 and built her small house in 2009 with the money she earns at work. She is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy a variety of fall clothes from Beijing, China.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell this fall.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 24 and still single. He is a simple man with a simple dream in life: to finish his college education and to soon help his mother financially. 

Rolando is helping his mother in managing their field. They plant rice crops in their field. Sometimes he does some field activities during the weekend so that the allotted funds for labor can be used for his allowance in school. Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for farming. Their aim is to minimize labor expenses and generate enough income from the crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Anacil

texts.en: Anacil is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this line of work for seven years, and has taken out and repaid six previous loans from NWFT and, more recently, Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santos Alfonsina

texts.es:
La señora Santos Alfonsina esta casada, tiene 35 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para su producción de tejidos, especialmente la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera que con el préstamo logre su objetivo de tener un negocio grande y con mucha ganancia.
texts.en: Alfonsina’s married and is 35-years-old.  She attended second grade.  She has two children attending school.  She’s a weaver.  She started the business with support from family members and to date has 15 years’ experience.  Her husband who is in the same business supports her efforts.  She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies needed to produce her textiles, especially various kinds of thread in assorted colors.  She hopes the loan will help her reach her goal of having a large, very profitable business.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

NWTF is re-listing Cristina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
Delmy, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Ella lleva tres años de dedicarse al comercio vende ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas y ropa interior, sandalias, sabanas y cosméticos como lociones, cremas, maquillajes, champú y otros. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ha mantenido su negocio mediante la inversión de préstamos, el actual que está solicitando es el tercer ciclo y es por 10,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa nueva y usada para surtir y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes en esta temporada de fin de año. Su plan es seguir ahorrando sus ganancias para poder mejorar su casa y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Delmy, 34, is married and has three children; she lives with her family in Tela, Atlántida.  She’s been a merchant for three years selling clothes like shirts, pants, blouses and underwear and sandals, sheets and cosmetics like lotions, creams, make-up, shampoo and others.  She does this from place to place and also based on prior orders.  She’s stayed in business by means of loans.  The one she’s asking for now is her third and it’s for 10,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy new and used clothes to fill end-of-year customer orders.  Her plan is to continue saving her profits to do some home improvements and to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo has been planting rice crops on his field for 27 years and earned PHP 7,000 from his last crop. He failed to earn as much money as he expected, however, because his crop was affected by pests. He wants to increase his rice production to meet his children’s needs and pay their school fees. It will be difficult for Reynaldo to do this because his earnings from his most recent crop were minimal. That is why he is requesting a loan for PHP 27,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farmland. He is hoping for a better crop so that he can save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Borrower Mrs. Oyun is a 38-year-old entrepreneur who has four children and lives with her family in an apartment that she got by mortgage loan.  Her elder two daughters attend state universities and the other two boys attend high school and kindergarten. 

Previously she has worked as a vet, then she began to operate her own shoe-selling business at the largest outdoor market of the city. Her husband works as a guard man at local airline company. 

Oyun is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a variety of boots for upcoming season. In the future, she plans to increase her working capital and finish her long-term mortgage loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of boots for upcoming season

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a district near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia that lacks basic infrastructure. She supports her family by selling clothing at a stall in the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been doing this for seven years and imports her clothing from Ereen, a city on the border between Mongolia and China. She also sells clothing which she makes herself.  She is an ambitious lady who wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to buy more clothing to sell this autumn.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell this fall.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita lives at Lanna with her spouse and three children. They are both involved in farming business, in which they grow rice and harvest it from a hectare plot of land that they cultivate. Carmelita hopes to increase her crop production to give sustenance to her children's education. 

For this, she is now borrowing PHP 35,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for sustenance. She hopes to produce an abundant harvest so she can also pay for school fees. 

In the future, with good funds from the business, she will give a better way of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for sustenance

loans.name: Cherry-Ann

texts.en: Cherry Ann is married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. In order to meet all of their needs, she and her husband grow rice and earn PHP 20,000 for each of the two crops they plant a year.  She also makes money on the side by raising hogs. Cherry Ann is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to ensure that she and her husband have a healthy harvest and earn a good income. She hopes to keep maintaining her business and earning a good income so she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for a farm.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Borrower Lkhagvasuren is 50 years old and lives with his son and daughter in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. While he is a qualified agricultural mechanic, he now works as a plumber; his daughter works as an operator and his son attends university. His wife supports his family by operating a sunglasses-selling business at the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.

Lkhagvasuren is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase roof-covering materials for their home.

loans.use: to purchase roof covering materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee cutters.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 24 years old and married to Kristian. They have a child who is in grade school. The couple patiently manages a rice-field inherited from her in-laws. The couple plants and harvests rice to sell and have been in the farming business for five years now. They usually gain PHP 20,000 twice a year during harvest season. Cheryl wanted to increase crop production, which will help alleviate her income too. She is now asking for additional capital to buy  fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides used in farming. She hopes to give nourishment to her crops for higher production. 

In the future, Cheryl and her spouse hope to become successful rice growers in their village and to improve their family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase poultry to meet market orders

loans.name: Dania Erlinda

texts.es:
Dania tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos con su esposo, y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Hace 4 años que Dania decidió dedicarse a su propio negocio para generar ingresos para el hogar, vende de manera ambulante y en su casa, ropa y variedad de cosméticos de marca, como cremas, perfumes, lociones, tratamientos y otros que le piden sus clientes, ya tiene clientes fijos en su aldea. Ella ha invertido ya varios prestamos al negocio para mantenerlo activo. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero y es por 20,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va surtir de productos como ropa para damas, caballeros y ropa interior y más cosméticos ya que viene la buena temporada y va aprovechar a incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Tiene como meta crecer con el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con una buena educación y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dania is 24 years old and married.  She and her husband have two children.  She lives in a village in the Tela municipality in Atlántida.

Four years ago Dania decided to pursue her own business in order to generate income for the household.  She sells in an itinerant manner and at her house.  She sells clothes, various brands of cosmetics, creams, perfumes, lotions, treatments, and others that her customers request.  She now has fixed customers in her village. 

She has already invested various loans in her business in order to keep it active.  The loan she is requesting is her third, and it is for 20,000 lempiras.  She will use this loan to stock up on products like clothing for women and men, underwear, and more cosmetics.  She will do this because the good season is coming, and she will take advantage of it to increase sales and her income.  Her goal is go grow with the business, to help her children with a good education, and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics like creams, perfume, lotion, hair treatments, and others to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the coffee-cutter laborers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more personal products to sell to customers.

NWTF is relisting Flora's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Vilma  tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía de  su esposo y 2 de sus hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de Trinidad, Departamento de de Santa Bárbara.
Doña Vilma  desde hace 28 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería donde ofrece: ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ropa interior para damas, sandalias, calzonetas y calcetines.
Con el propósito de aprovechar la temporada navideña que es donde las ventas aumentan, Vilma ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad 10,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa, sandalias, calzonetas,pantalones,calcetines y cameras.
Manifiesta estar satisfecha con su negocio, ya que sus utilidades las destina para el sostenimiento de la familia cubriendo sus necesidades básicas.
Da gracias a ODEF Financiera y a Kiva por la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo y la confianza recibida.
texts.en: Vilma, 56, is married and has three children.  She lives in company of her husband and two of her children in an urban community in Trinidad, Santa Bárbara Department.  She’s been selling merchandise like clothes for women, men and children, women’s underwear, sandals, bathing suits, pants, shocks and t-shirts.  She says she’s satisfied with her business because she uses profits to support her family and cover basic needs.  She thanks ODEF and Kiva for the opportunity of getting a loan and for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and a mother of two dependents. She is 42 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. 

Nancy is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She delivers vegetables, like leafy vegetables, to the local market. She has been doing this business for three years. She earns PHP 2,100 each month in this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Nancy became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Nancy hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production, and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more firewood to sell.  NWTF is relisting Genara's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Jugando dominó y tomando cervezas, los vecinos de Dagoberto departen los fines de semana en su negocio; esto fué lo que hizo que con la inversión de su credikiva en refescos y cervezas, lograra aumentar sus ventas y obtener mas utilidades. En la actualidad ya está pensando en las fiestas decembrinas entre vecinos y quiere estar muy preparado para ellas, por eso está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con  el cual comprará cervezas en cantidades mayores, y de contado, para hacer su meor venta del año con sus propios vecinos que de manera sana se acercan y comparten alegremente con sus familias en las instalaciones del negocio de Dagoberto. Su mensaje a los fiancaidoresde Kiva es el siguiente: " Estoy muy agradecido con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con Kiva" pues ha mejorado mucho sus ventas; él espera continuar contando con el apoyo de estas dos organizaciones, para progresar y conseguir el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y de su familia.
texts.en: Dagoberto’s neighbors spend weekends playing dominoes and drinking beer in his place of business.  He used his Kiva loan to buy soft-drinks and beer to increase sales and earn higher profits.  He’s currently already thinking about the December festivities among his neighbors and wants to be ready for them which is why he’s applying for a new loan to pay cash for larger amounts of beer to have the best sales of the year among his neighbors who come with their families to enjoy Dagoberto’s establishment in a joyful, healthy way.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to Kiva.”  He has increased sales very much and hopes to continue to be able to count on support from both these organizations to make progress and attain a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay cash for larger amounts of beer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Campo 5, Aurora. She is 51 years old. Myrna is married and has six children. To make a living, she manages a retail business where she buys and sells fish, and she also has a small sari-sari store (convenience store). She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 6,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC. Myrna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish to resell and to purchase new items for her inventory, such as candies, shampoos, soaps, and Milo (a chocolate and malt beverage). She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell and to purchase new items for her inventory, such as candies, shampoos, soaps, and Milo (a chocolate and malt beverage).

loans.name: Nathaly Liseth

texts.es:
Nathaly es una joven de 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, Nathaly es una joven muy entusiasta, logro estudiar la carrera de biología y por ello trabaja en un fundo agrícola en el área de control de calidad, con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres ya que no tienen muchos ingresos económicos; Nathaly cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy honrada y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Nathaly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que con su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar camas para ella y sus padres ya que debido a un accidente perdieron sus enseres en su vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio laboratorio y poder seguir ayudando a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Nathaly, 24, lives in the city of Ica.  Nathaly is a very enthusiastic young woman.  She managed to study biology and she works in an agricultural agency in the area of quality control.  With the fruit of her labor she helps her parents because they don't have much income.  Nathaly believes it's going well for her in her job because she's very honest and, above all, responsible.

Nathaly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their big help she'll be able to buy beds for herself and her parents, who lost all their furniture in an accident in their home.

This way she'll be able to improve her quality of life and continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: "To have her own laboratory and continue helping her parents."

loans.use: to buy beds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the coffee pickers.

loans.name: Almanzor

texts.es:
Almazor tiene 55 años de edad, es padre de familia ya que es padre de 9 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposa darían la vida por ellos. Almanzor es muy entusiasta y trabajador, día a día trabaja en su parcela en la cual ha sembrado yuca, el le dedica a su sembrío alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que es muy cuidadoso y siempre está al pendiente, por ello el cree que le va bien, Almanzor aprendió todo lo que sabe de agricultura gracias a sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde pequeño.

Almanzor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, arar, entre otros, lo que le permitirá poder tener una mejor cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Almanzor is 55 years old.  He is the head of his family, as he is the father of nine children whom he loves very much and for whom he and his wife would give their lives.  Almanzor is very enthusiastic and hardworking.  He works on his plot of land day after day sowing yucca.  He spends around 10 hours per day with his crops as he is very thorough and he is always on call, which is why he believes things are going well for him.  Almanzor learned everything he knows about farming from his parents who taught him when he was very young.

Almanzor is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy fertilizers and a plow, among other things that will allow him to have a better harvest and increase his income.  This will allow him to keep working and fighting to make his greatest dream come true: to give his children a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a plow, among other things.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He is a dedicated farmer who always visits his farm to ensure that his crops are in good condition.
